1.content:
For some or perhaps many of us we believe in the possibility of alternate realities co-existing along ours. Some with very little difference and others with so much difference that it's hard to accept them. There are even a few who believe in the existence of a Utopia type reality where everything is as perfect as it can be. Is it possible for such a picture perfect reality to exist? For Jake Young he believes in the Utopia or picture perfect reality, and even now he wishes for a mean to travel to that reality.

Jake stretched his arms out lying in his bed as his alarm went off. " Ugh..Six thirty in the morning already? I'm going back to bed." He then went and pressed the snoozed button on his alarm and covered himself back up. Just as Jake was about to fall back asleep his younger sister came in. "Wake up sleepy head, your going to be late. Jake groaned as he was disturbed from his slumber. " Not now sis." His Sister then looked up at him sternly. " Jake, Do we have to go through this every morning? Just get up already!" She yelled. Jake sighed. "Fine." Jake got out of bed, got his clothes out of his drawer and headed for the shower. Once he was done with the shower he went out and got dressed and went to the breakfast table. " Ready, for School dear?" His mom asked. " Mom! Do you have to ask that every single day?" He asked. " Of course, I care about all my little pumpkins." Your mother replied. "MOM! We're not little anymore can't you stop calling us that?!" Jake and his sister responded. " I know you two are growing older but to me you'll always be my little pumpkins, anyhow your birthday gift from your great Aunt Diane should be arriving once school is over. It's strange how her presents always seem to get lost in the mail." Your mom says. Jake's great Aunt Diane is his grandmothers sister, though he has had very little contact with her in the last few years. "Alright I get it, I'll be off now" Jake said after giving his mother a hug, he then went out and drove to school.


Jake's day at school went on the same as usual. Nothing of big notice happened or any fights, at least to Jake's Knowledge. Before Jake knew it it was finally lunch time. Jake set as his usual place with his friend Joe. "Hey there how's it going?" Joe asked. " Same as usual dull as our principal Mr. Uptight." Jake replied. " Careful, heard he's in a bad mood today Jake." " Mr. Uptight is always in a bad mood, he punishes people just for the sake of it, if you ask me.." Joe interrupts. "Jake, careful." Jake continues. " Why Mr. Uptight and tidy widy near or something?" "Not just near but right behind you Mr. Young and for your comments and name calling your principal I think you should spend some time in detention. Don't you?" The principal asked. Jake shook his head. " It was just a mistake Mr. Upton." Mr. Upton gave Jake a stern look. " Very well I'll let you off this time but if I find you calling me Mr. Uptight and tidy widy again, don't expect to be so lucky." Mr. Upton then left Jake and Joe waited awhile to ensure the principal was nowhere to be seen. " That sure was a close call Jake." Joe said. Jake simply nodded. Lunch was now over and Jake and Joe went to there afternoon classes. The afternoon classes were pretty much the same as the early morning classes and went by just as fast, except for last period which always seemed to last the longest especially that very last minute. Jake didn't have any other plans today so he went home.

"Jake your gift from Aunt Diane arrived, though I think it's a bit of an unusual gift for her to send a boy." Your sister said. " Unusual? Sounds interesting I'll have to look at it. Thanks Sally." Sally responded. " No problem Mom put it in your room." Jake curious of his unusual gift from his Aunt Diane went straight to his room to look at it. "That is an unusual gift, but Aunt Diane always has stories attach to her gifts I wonder what the story of this one is?" Jake thought as he looked at his gift a two way mirror with a bow and a letter attached to it. Jake took off the letter unaware of a second letter that was attached to the other side, and he read the letter:

Dear Jake,

I hope you like your birthday present for your sixteenth birthday. It's been quite a few years since we have actually spoken or seen each other. I'm sure you are also curious of what the story behind this gift is? Well I'll let you in on a little secret I've kept from you. You see this mirror is what send me here to this reality. It took me over fifty years to find it again, and as much as I missed my old reality. I would miss you more if I went back so I decide to give you this as a gift. The Mirror names is actually called the Mirror of Reality, now I know that seems crazy but if you don't believe me just try it out. But I warn you going back isn't as easy as that. The mirror connects to many multiple realities. I remember our last talk we had when you were wishing to travel to another reality. After a few years it took awhile but once I found this Mirror I decided to give it to you, I hope you enjoy it Jake and Happy Birthday!

With Love,
From your Aunt Diane.

Jake thought to himself," A mirror of Reality that can take a person to another reality? That's a good one. Still maybe it really does work. If it does perhaps I can find a reality that really is picture perfect"! Jake was hesitant at first questioning whether the mirror could do such a thing. He was also curious to see the possibilities of an actual picture perfect reality. Although he read all of the first letter he still had no clue how to get the mirror to work. His Sister then walked into his room. " So what's the crazy story on this mirror Jake? She asked. "Well according to Aunt Diane she came from another reality and this is the Mirror of Reality that sent her here." Sally then laughed. " That's even more silly then her last gift!" Jake responded. " What if it's true though?" Sally then looked and noticed the second letter. " Jake I doubt that story holds up true, but from the looks of it there's another letter from her." Sally said pointing at the letter Jake missed. Jake then went and picked up and read that letter. "This letter explains how to use the mirror but not much else." Jake said. Sally looked at Jake and then ask. " Then why don't you show me?" Jake nodded and began to say the phrase that would activate the mirror. " Oh Mirror of Reality, grant me my desire that I seek to travel to another reality!" Jake and Sally looked at the mirror at first nothing seemed to be happening and then a fog suddenly appeared in Jake's room. "Jake I..don't like this." Sally said. "Walk through the Mirror and your desire shall be granted" A voice came from the mirror. At first Jake wasn't sure whether he should of believed his Great Aunt or not but now he was sure and curious to see a picture perfect reality. " Jake! Don't GO!" Sally yelled. It was useless as Jake was entranced by the possibilities that he saw the Mirror now glowing an eerie blue with the mirror his reflection faded and the mirror instead of reflecting changed to white. Jake's own curiosity got the better of him as he went through the White where the portal was. His sister could only watch helplessly as he went through. Neither of them aware of Jake's mistake instead of sending him to his picture perfect reality it sent him to another reality randomly since he neglected to specify the reality. The only question is which reality did Jake get sent to?
1.title: The Gift

11.content: As Jake went through the mirror he couldn't see much of where he was going everything was all white. least until he finally reached the end of a portal. Jake looked at his surroundings and expected to be in his picture perfect reality, but much to his surprise everything seemed backwards in this reality almost as if he had gone back through time. He then saw a young woman in colonial clothes and asked her. He asked her what year it was. He expected that he had also traveled through time, but much to his dismay he found out he didn't. He looked around at his surroundings and noticed that there was no electricity, computers or even a hint of technology that was seen in his reality! Jake quickly ran back to the place he arrived expecting the mirror to be there so he could go back, only to realize that it wasn't there! He remembered that his Aunt Diane's letter had mentioned that going back isn't easy. So this is what she meant, I'll have to find the mirror every time I enter another reality?Jake thought. Jake then noticed with his clothes he stands out like a sore thumb in this reality. He decided that he needed to find out more about this reality, find appropriate attire, and find the mirror so he could get out of this reality. The first thing Jake decided to do was...

It was then that you realized that there are modern conveniences in this reality, although it seems only the privileged classes who reside on what is known as the mainland get them. Jake realized that in this reality that one of the major events that happened in the past of his reality never happened! However what he didn't know was why it didn't happen, with his new found knowledge of this world he first got some proper clothes from his sister, and then decided to...

1111.content: See his mother since she might be able to give him more information about this reality. " Sally can you take me to mom?" Jake asked. Sally simply nodded and then took him to his house in this reality. His house looked to be something that would be on a display in a museum from his reality, it was a simple log cabin. His mother looked at him bewildered by the question. " Public Library? You must have hurt yourself bad Jake, there's no such thing as a public library, though there are some nobles who have there own personal library." Jake was learning quite a bit today but still hadn't learned anything useful. " No public library? I wonder why? Maybe I should ask about some of the famous figures from the time of the revolution. But who?" Jake thought. Jake thought of a few that he remembered were quite famous in his reality to ask about the first was George Washington the first president of the United States in his reality. The second was Benjamin Franklin, and then his final option was Benedict Arnold. Jake decided to ask about...
1111.title: A Mother's Knowledge

choices: Jake has a few more questions, but thinks he might like to stay in this reality.
Jake wants to find the mirror and transport himself to a different world now.
11111.content:
“Well, I'd really like to learn more about history, Mother,” insisted Jake. “I know we can't afford a library, but perhaps you could tell me what you know about, oh, let's say George Washington?”

Jake's mother visibly stiffened her posture. She looked nervous and uncomfortable now, suddenly twitching and fidgeting anxiously.

“Why would you wish to know about him?” mother replied.

Clearly in this reality, thought Jake, George Washington was hardly the faithful, forthright, famous father of his country! Best to tread carefully. This was a different history indeed, doubtlessly with deep consequences of whatever distant fracture in time had created this reality.

“Oh, me and some friends were just talking about how rotten he was,” Jake said, trying to sound casual and off-handed. “And it just struck me that I never really learned exactly why George Washington was such a villain.”

Jake's mother relaxed and actually smiled a bit.

“I suppose it's been my patriotic duty to tell you these things,” she said. “And I've been a bit lax in that, haven't I? Sit down Jake, and I'll try to recall all I learned as a little girl about the American Rebellion.”

The American Rebellion, thought Jake. It's even got a new name. This was interesting stuff. He sat before his mother's feet and listened intently to her tale.

“It was back in the 1770s,” Jake's mother said. “Parliament had passed some new taxes, and here in the colonies people were very poor. They found it difficult to pay these taxes. Some foolish landowners led by Colonel George Washington started an armed rebellion against the crown. Washington and his despicable rebels actually achieved some success, waging a guerrilla war of tiny acts of terrorism committed here and there throughout mostly rural pockets of the colonies. The turning point came when General Charles Cornwallis bravely led His Majesty's Army against the rebels at an obscure little forgotten place called Valley Forge. The insurgents escaped justice however, in what's known as the Winter March. Fleeing from Cornwallis and his men, they trekked from Pennsylvania to Virginia, during a bitterly cold winter storm. Many of the traitors died during that blizzard.”

“The rest of the war,” mother continued. “Was a foregone conclusion for Cornwallis and His Majesty's Army. The crown bravely fought against the rebels, gradually whittling them down bit by bit in a series of successful battles. The final blow came in 1781 when we decimated the American army at Yorktown. Washington and his rebels surrendered to General Cornwallis. The leaders of the revolt were tried for treason, convicted, and hanged. Let's see, it would have been: Washington, Jefferson, Franklin, Hancock, and … oh, dear, that's all I can remember. Back in school, we had to memorize the names of all these infamous criminals.”

“After the traitors were hanged,” said Jake's mother. “There were a few more years of minor violent uprisings, but they were all easily extinguished by General Banastre Tarleton's highly effective Loyalist Legion. They were the new garrison assigned to permanently guard us here in colonies from dangerous terrorists. They hunted down and brought to justice all the other members of the terrorist group calling themselves The Minutemen. So successful were the Loyalist Legion that they began to see use around the globe in the years to come. That's why to this day, the Empire's special forces commandos are known as Tarleton's Legion. And no doubt, you've read the exciting stories in the papers about Tarleton's Legion seeing action around the Empire, fighting bravely against dirty insurgents everywhere from Ireland to South Africa, from India to southeast Asia.”

That was quite an interesting history lesson, thought Jake. But he had more questions.

“Mom, why did you get so nervous when I first asked about all this?” Jake said innocently. “I mean, it's all ancient history, right? Who cares about George Washington nowadays?”

“There are still misguided, foolish people out there who revere these traitors,” mom answered, her voice dropping to almost a whisper. “Don't forget the failed Lincoln-Lee rebellion of the 1850s. And nearly a hundred years after that, there was Colonel Eisenhower's coup attempt, back when the crown was distracted by the Second War of Europe.”

“So people are actually still trying to overthrow Britain and achieve independence here?” Jake asked.

“Shhh! Don't speak of such things,” insisted mom. “We are a loyalist household and always shall be. But yes you're right, there is a covert cabal – Freemasons, most of them – who speak highly of Washington and seek a return to the sad, dark days of his failed rebellion. They honor him as the secret Grand Master of American Independence. But Jake, they are not glorious freedom fighters. They are dangerous and deadly criminals. I don't want you getting caught up in all this nonsense. Our family has always been steadfast, dependable subjects of the crown. The cabal is dangerous, subversive, and downright treasonous. Murderers, thieves, and terrorists the lot of them! So stay faithful, true, and patriotic Jake, and you'll have nothing to fear.”
11111.title: This is George Washington?!

Jake looked through the web real quick to see how history was affected by this, and found that for the most part history was roughly unchanged. As a result, race relations seemed a rather moot issue compared to your world.

However Jake did see that in all the pictures he saw, both historical and present, he never once saw any traces of pants or even shorts, and the amounts of cleavage and occasional side/underboob was insane. Everyone seemed to wear skirts and skimpy tops, as though pants and conservative tops had never been invented... In fact the most conservative thing he found was chain mail on medieval knights on Wikipedia, and that looked like a dress under a plate mail tube top and miniskirt. This made him wonder, because he hadn't stopped to look at his clothes in depth.

Looking down, Jake saw his neckline plunging way down showing off ample cleavage, and the bottom of his shirt lifted an inch or so to show off his feminine midriff, but otherwise Jake's shirt didn't look too different, but then he looked below his shirt and chest and saw his jeans were now a denim miniskirt, and below that he wore kneehigh socks with sneakers that oddly had a small heel to them. "I look trampy!!" he said at his own visage.

Sally walking by, hears Jake, and looks at her "sister," going, "What does this word, 'trampy,' mean?"

Jake suddenly realized this practically slutty style of attire was normal and commonplace for this world, and maybe the concept of "trashy" or "trampy" clothes didn't exist, which made him feel all the more awkward (and exposed).

"Nevermind." he said, as he goes back to the computer for a moment. "Maybe I should hurry up and get out of here... However, something is bugging me... Should I check it out...?"

Jake...

"Do I really want to know? Yeah... I'd shoot myself if I didn't find out." Fumbling through the web, Jake looks up reproductive health and gets the shock of his life after pulling up a medical website. "At the age of 18, all girls begin growing a fully-functioning penis, becoming functional roughly six weeks after growth begins, and can slowly acquire length and girth for the following year thereafter as it continues to develop, as internal organs similar to testicles form attaches to the ovaries, becoming stronger and more potent over the female's 18th year, reaching maximum fertility around their 19th birthday when their penis is fully formed, fertility levels remaining constant for the next 5-7 year thereafter...."

Jake closes the browser and puts his head in his arms. "Just had to know, didn't you, Jake?" Getting up, he decides, "Well, guess I should get out of here before I discover any other strange facts I don't want to know..." As he heads back to his room, he asks, "Now, where did I put that mirror?"

13.content:
As Jake went through the mirror he was about to fall to the ground, only to be caught by his sister Sally. " You need to lose some weight Jake, your quite heavy." She said. Jake looked around and noticed he was still in his room, or at least that's what he thought. " Aw... The Mirror didn't work I'm still in the same reality. Sally then looked to Jake and then responded. " Guess again, you are very much in a different reality." Sally said. " What?! but I'm still in my room, What's so different about this one, then mine?" Jake asked. " Maybe you and I should compare realities and try to find out." Sally suggested. Jake walked out of Sally's arms and into a chair. The two of them began exchanging various information they knew about there realities. Eventually when Jake brought up things that had a Scientific explanation behind them, Sally brought up that in this world those thing are explained by magic. " So do you know the difference between our realities now?" Sally asked. "I think so, basically magic exists everywhere in this world and is used daily. Even for computers, and anything that in my reality that would be explained in Scientific terms is considered Magic. Sally simply nodded at this.

" Now that you are here Jake, what do you plan to do?" Sally asked. " I think I'll try this reality out a bit, the Mirror is right behind me right?" Jake then looked behind him to the spot where he once was only to find the mirror gone. Jake looked surprised to find that the mirror was gone. " What happened to the mirror?! it was right in the room earlier!" Jake said. Sally responds, " Relax, Jake I'm sure we can find it, You might be staying in this reality longer than you thought." After hearing that Jake calmed down a little. "Okay so I just have to find the mirror again, then I'll be able to return." Sally nods. " No need to panic, besides you might find that since just about anyone can use magic in this reality, things might be more fun."

It was now late at night and Jake had nothing else he can do for now so he decided to get some rest for now. He didn't know that his little sister had planned some minor mischief with magic while he was asleep. Sally slowly sneaked into Jake's room trying not to make even the slightest noise. "Sorry, Jake but I'm going to have some fun with you now." She whispered. As she approached Jake sleeping comfortably on his bed she began to cast her spell. Little did Jake know that when he wakes up he would be transformed into....
13.title: A Magical World

133.content:
As Jake woke up he found himself transformed into the body of an eight year old girl. He was about to scream at the top of his lungs until he managed to convince himself not to. "Calm down Jake, remember this a highly developed world of Magic, and the only one who knows I'm not the real Jake from this world she must have transformed me but why? Jake thought. Jake eventually went and found Sally. "Sally why'd you turn me into a little girl?" Jake asked. "That's an easy one your at the age where people start to develop magic and when they're that age it's customary to turn them into the opposite gender. " She responded.

"Are you saying you're not going to change me back?" Jake asked. Sally then quickly shook her head as she smiled gently towards Jake. "It's best you learn all that you can, and since the brother I know has lots of knowledge in Magic compared to your reality. It's best you star learning magic at the age when he started." Jake realized that knowing magic was apparently essential to surviving in this world. Sally then gave Jake a quick crash course in being a little girl. They then headed towards school. Jake was amazed by everything in this world operating with magic was of course unique the best part of being in a world where magic ruled was that there was no pollution in the air. The air itself was much more cleaner and fresher. When him and Sally went separate ways and he finally began his Magic training he found it rather...

14.content:
Jake didn't notice but Sally desperate not wanting Jake to go and scared of losing her brother had followed him through the mirror and into the reality. Jake and Sally both fell to the floor. " Aw, I got my skirt dirty!" Sally said. Jake looked around and noticed that they weren't in his room anymore. They were in a small warehouse, close to the ocean. Jake then got up and looked surprised to see that Sally followed him. "Sally?! Why'd you follow me? He asked. Sally dusted off her skirt and then responded. " When I was looking at the mirror I thought I saw something horrible in this reality, I tried to warn you, but you were so insistent on coming here I had no choice to follow." Jake took a quick look around to try and notice anything that was different from his reality, but all he could see was a dirty old warehouse. " Doesn't look like there's much danger to me. " Jake said.

Jake and Sally then went outside the warehouse, they were still unsure of what this reality had to offer, or what happened. As Sally was walking out of the warehouse, she noticed a small book in the corner and ran to pick it up. It was a book on the history of world war 2. "Maybe, I'll find a clue in this book." She thought.

As they both came outside, they smelled the salty air breeze and heard the ocean waves. The sky still looked the same to them at least, that was until Jake saw a UFO landing in an airport. " Wow! I actually saw an actual UFO!" Jake said. " We are going to be seeing a lot more of them Jake." Jake then turned to Sally who was immersed in the book and then asked. "What do you mean?" Sally quickly responded. " Well according to this book I'm reading aliens took over the world way back in World War Two." Jake then asked. " Then what happened to the humans?" Sally sighs and then responds..
14.title: Aliens rule the world?!

They wake up in an alien's home (apparently the "owner" of their counterparts)
142.content:
"The aliens keep humans as pets," Sally said, "They breed us like animals and apparently condition us to obey them without question."

"Great," Jake said sarcastically, "Come on, let's go find the mirror and get out of this reality - I don't know about you, but I don't want to end up some Martian's pet."

However, before they could walk back into the warehouse, there was a sudden humming sound, and all of a sudden something flew down to land in front of them. It was an eight-foot tall bluish-gray robot; its body was a tube, with about a half a dozen arms sticking out of the torso, a disk at the bottom emitting a blue glow that seemed to be keeping it hovering in the air, and a head that was just a sphere with a single glowing green eye.

"Wild humans detected," the robot stated in a monotone, "Beginning capture process."

"Wha- wait!" Jake said, holding up his hands in a pleading manner.

"Don't talk to it! Run!" Sally shouted, turning to run herself. Unfortunately, before either of them could get anywhere, the robot extended two of its arms, firing off streams of electric-blue energy. The energy hit Jake and Sally; they yelled in shock and pain, before they fell to the ground, unconscious.
142.title: "We're pets to the aliens"

Do we stick with the pet store, or do they wake up in a pound instead?

14211.content:
Jake woke up wondering where he was. When he woke up he saw he was surrounded by metal bars. Then he realized he was in a cage. The cage was similar to a dog cage. He looked down and saw that he was naked except for a collar around his neck. He wondered what the hell was going on, but then he remembered what Sally said; humans were pets to the aliens . He looked outside the cage and saw a sign that said, Human Male 129.99, and it was followed by some weird symbol, presumably the alien currency. Then, he looked around and saw other cages that had humans in them. He wondered which one Sally was in, if she was even in one. "Sally, are you here?" he whispered.

"Jake?" she responded. "Good you're safe."

"For now... but we need to get out of here. I don't want to be a pet. Especially to some stupid alien." he whispered back. Then, they heard footsteps. Jake looked out of the cage to get a glimpse of who it was. He saw that the alien was-
14211.title: Pet store

choices: The girl aliens are nice owners
The girl aliens are cruel owners
142111.content:
the alien was humanoid. In-fact there were two of them. Both of them had the physical traits of humans. They both looked like young teenage girls. One of them had blonde hair, and wore a white sweatshirt with blue jeans and black boots. The other had brownish hair and wore a pink top with blue jeans and white sneakers. Jake was glad to know that they weren't hideous looking. They walked slowly and looked at all the cages.

"So many decisions." one of them said. They looked around and Sally caught the attention of the brunette alien. She looked down at her and said, "Aww, this human's cute. I think I want this one." Sally had a scared look on her. The alien looked at her for a few more seconds, "Yeah I definitely want this human. Which one are you getting?" She asked the other alien.

"I'm not sure yet." She responded. They both continued to look around. Jake panicked. He was about to get separated from Sally.

"Jake, help me." Sally whispered.

"I don't know what to do." He responded. He knew that he couldn't escape. So his best bet would be to get chosen by the other alien so him and Sally can at least be together. But the alien wasn't paying attention to him. He needed to get the alien to want him. After a few seconds, he realized what he had to do. He remembered how puppies would get chosen on Earth. He needed to act like a cute puppy. "Here it goes..." he sighed. The two alien girls were busy checking out some other human.

"Bark! Bark!" he yelped. He caught the attention of both of them and they walked towards his cage. He started to pant like a puppy. He looked up at the alien girls and smiled with a cute face.

"Awwwwwwwwww" both of them sighed. "This one's cute too. Okay let's go tell the worker." They walked away and Jake put his head down in disgust at the way he acted. He wasn't a pet, but he certainly didn't want to get separated from Sally either. He saw the alien girls return with another alien that looked like a young adult dude.

"So which humans do you want?" he asked.

"This one, and that one" The blonde alien answered as she pointed towards Sally and Jakes' cage. The alien guy then walked towards Sally's cage and let her out. He attached a leash to her and handed it to the brunette. Then, he walked towards Jake's cage and did the same thing. He handed his leash to the blonde. After that, they all headed for the front counter. The blonde tugged Jake's leash and he walked by her side. Well, not really walked. He had to be on all fours since he was a pet. It was difficult adjusting to getting around that way. But he walked by her side. When they got to the counter, the girl aliens were talking about the payment with the guy. Jake looked at Sally awkwardly. It was weird seeing her without clothes and it just didn't seem right.

"We need to find the mirror, and fast" Jake whispered. Suddenly, the girls tugged their leash and started to walk out. As they walk home, it turns out that
142111.title: Humanoid

1421111.content: As they walked out of the pet shop, Jake and Sally were shocked. They didn't recognize where they were. They looked up and saw very tall buildings. They were in a huge city that looked futuristic. The aliens tugged their leashes to get them to walk again. Jake noticed that the sidewalk was a conveyor belt. Then, they got on the conveyor belt and waited to see where the aliens were taking them. After about 5 minutes, they got off at
1421111.title: The girl aliens are nice owners

14211112.content:
The alien girls tugged their leashes and they got off the conveyor sidewalk. Jake looked around and noticed a sign that said "Human Park". They started walking in the park. Jake saw that there were other humans at the park aswell. Three of them were playing with their owners, four were running around, one was sniffing around, and the others were just relaxing. Jake was disgusted. They weren't humans. They were just mindless pets. The alien girls stopped walking. The blonde bent down towards Jake and said, "You go play with the other humans, okay?". Then, she unhooked his leash and petted him on the head. The other one did the same to Sally. Afterwards, the girls headed off for a bench, and Jake and Sally walked away so they could talk together.

"I can't handle this, we need to find the mirror" Jake uttered.

"But where would we find it?" Sally whispered. Jake looked around the park. After a few minutes of silence he thought of something. He noticed there wasn't any fences surrounding the park.

"Okay we need to escape. I think we can escape while no one is looking." Jake whispered.

"But what if we get caught." Sally replied.

"We'll be fine." he quickly answered. Jake looked at where the alien girls, or their owners (but he disliked using that term), were. They were still sitting on the bench and they were busy playing with some weird technological device. He looked around and saw no other aliens were watching them. "Okay now's our chance. Run for it." he ordered. Sally and him ran, still on all fours, towards where they came in. And-
14211112.title: a human park

choices: Jake and Sally's owners take them home
142111121.content:
Jake and Sally found themselves twitching on the ground from the electric fence that activated their shock collars. Eventually, they recovered enough to crawl under a tree and catch their breath.

"That......hurt." Jake managed to gasp out in a pained whisper.

His sister Sally nodded, rubbing her neck. "Yeah. We're going to have to be more careful about our escape here."

Jake nodded and began to look around. Their owners hadn't even looked up at them when they made their attempt at escape, humans must try that the first few times, he figured. And as far as the aliens were concerned, he and Sally were wild humans. It made sense that they'd try an escape.

While they caught their breath, a human boy, looking just a bit younger than Sally and Jake hurried up, and nudged them, seemingly trying to get them to follow. Looking to where the boy was trying to take them, Jake saw other humans wrestling in the field, and judging by the looks the aliens had, it was how humans played together, like how dogs chased each other. But wrestling naked with other humans didn't really strike him as "fun", but they did have to maintain the charade that they were humans from this reality...
142111121.title: There's an electric fence

14233.title: other

choices: They head to the Neju base...
The Ferrions attack again, but with something Merido has never seen before!!
142331.content:
Jake began to groggily awaken, feeling a woosh of wind blow by his face. When he looked over, what he saw jolted him to consciousness, for he had nearly met his end from flying shrapnel landing just left of his head. He shoots up, to see the whole area ablaze, smoke in the sky. "Sally!! Wake up!!"

"But I don't need to go to school, mommy. It's Saturday..."

"School's the least of your problems!!" Jake yells as he lifts her head and peels her eyes open.

"Oh, everything's on fire. I thought it was something important." Sally then falls back asleep. She was always so hard to rouse.

Just then, an explosion throws the duo in the air and finally jolts Sally awake. "What was..." Jake looked up and saw a slender figure in boots, gauntlets, and bodysuit that had glowing pink lines and contrails all over it. It was staring down another one of those robots that knocked them out earlier, when it conjured a pink energy between its hands and fired it at the robot, then made a sphere of the same energy, crushed it in its hand, creating a pink energy blade, and cut another bot in half that was attacking from behind.

Another slender alien in the same garb, but sky blue lights and contrails glowing from their equipment and suit, flew right through a robot, blowing it up, then roundhouse kicked another one into a swarm of approaching fighters, somehow depositing a glowing blue orb of energy into the center of the robot, which detonated when it flew amongst the futuristic jets, the explosion devastating the whole fighter wing.

A third slender figure walked up from behind Jake and Sally, it's glow being silver, and wearing heavy armor on its legs, arms, back, and shoulders. Suddenly clamps in its boots slam down into the cement and lock it into place. Jake is surprised when he hears it speak English, and it's voice a very high pitched female's voice, yelling, "Target Lock!! Armageddon System is a GO!!" Blinding the two kids sight, thousands of lasers and missiles soar from this one alien, soaring up to take out three giant practically Rhode Island-sized UFOs coming down from the clouds, followed by her raising her hands in a Kamehameha fashion. Just before this hellstorm was to hit, a lime green blur snatched them up, the jolt in speed nearly making Sally heave. Jake could barely stand the G-forces he was under as he looked back, most everything a muddy blur, but was able to see the devastation unleashed by the silver alien. The whole sky was white, the mushroom cloud was on par with Hiroshima. The earth was trembling with the force of this skyward explosion, which Jake felt vibrate through the alien that was carrying them. Suddenly, the alien seemed to lose its footing, tripping and stumbling, but managing to stay on its feet until it came to a stop. Once stopped, Jake could see more clearly, and saw the alien's rear much more clearly now that all the blood wasn't rushing to his eyeballs. This one too had a very feminine shape, especially in her hips and butt, and then he saw poking out of the suit above her butt with wires wrapped around it to a ring on the end of it was a black furry tail, a tail that looked very feline.

Suddenly, you hear a vomiting sound, and the alien drops you and Sally, as she screams, also in a similarly extra-feminine voice, "Aw, all over my suit!! You could of warned me you were going to lurch..." She turned around and produced green lasers from her fingertips which seemed to clean her suit, as though by magic. Jake gasped when he saw her, as her face looked so very human. If not for the slit orange feline eyes black cat ears, cat tail, and indigo hair cut in a bob, she could easily pass for a human girl of around Jake's age.

Sally yelled, "Not another one!!" cringing at the sight of the girl.

Jake goes for the obvious and says, "Alright, I'm confused."

The alien girl says, "Now, I don't think we've elicited responses like that from a human since we came here to fight the Ferrions."

"Ferrions?" Jake exclaimed. "Listen... lady. I have no idea who these 'Ferrions' are, unless you're talking about those weird robot things that zapped us, but we're new here and very confused..."

"Alright... Something's up..." the alien says.

"Well, I don't know if you'll believe us, but here goes..." Jake recounts their tale so far to her, telling her about their world, and the mirror, and how they got here.

"I bet you don't believe a word I said."

"Are you mad? This is very serious. Of course I believe you. Multiple universes are a key part of quantum mechanics and the Multiverse Law. Moreso, you've found a way to move objects on the macroscopic scale across the multiverse, something no one has yet to do. Only the Ferrions, we Neju, and the Kelmar Enclave have even managed to send microscopic information between universes, but the energy costs are astronomical, and the Ferrions have a leg-up on us by being a bio-mechanical race, so they can send nanomachines with genetic data over and assemble themselves in other universes, gathering new technology and territory from alien realms while we have no way to stop them unless we ever get the womanpower to attack their homeworld and knock out their central plexus."

"Now I have a headache." Jake groaned. "Multiverse Laws, Ferrions, Neju, Kelmar Enclave... What does it all mean?"

"All we know is that we found a book detailing that after World War II, the Earth was conquered..." Sally said.

"Yes, by the Ferrions." the alien said. "They go about the cosmos enslaving and forcing sentient species to be their playthings as they exploit their resources. They are a mostly mechanical cybernetic species that sucker punched our people, the Neju, and our homeworld, many millenia ago, much like that attack by the Japanese on that Naval base you humans called Pearl Harbor, knowing if they faced us at full power, we would easily stop their campaign. Now we go about and liberate the oppressed peoples they capture and free their worlds, fighting back their scourge."

"Yeah, I saw how awesomely you guys kicked butt back there." Jake exclaimed. "However, if you could stomp them that easy, why can't you beat them once and for all?"

"Numbers. Ferrions can engineer and build millions of new lifeforms a day. Meanwhile, the four of us you saw are the only Neju here on Earth, and while the liberated humans try their best with the training and equipment we can afford them in the little spare time we have, it's just a sad fact we haven't been able to fully calibrate Neju technology to human physiology. Another problem Neju technology was specifically designed for the female body and brain, and too many Earth men have antiquated notions about women's right on this world."

"Wait, why is your technology designed for women only?" Sally asked.

"Our males are very primal, and almost resemble your Earthly lions. For some reason, which our anthropologists are still trying to discover, unlike in humans, only the Neju female body and brain evolved rapidly over time, while even now the males are still solitary creatures, living like aboriginal tribal people, only speaking ancient tongues and using old technologies. At best, they are no more advanced than you humans were during your 'Dark Ages,' which is a neat accomplishment given they're quadrupeds. They only come amongst us females in the mega-cities to breed and raise our children up to a certain point, and then they return to the jungles. As a result of our evolutionary advantage, all us females developed a hyper-advanced civilization with some of the most advanced technology in the universe. We built said tech to suit our needs and wants, so best to synchronize with it. Finally, we developed our greatest tech, these combat suits that actually derive their power from 'maternal mana,' or the female ability to create life within herself. We harness chi within our uterus, cascade it throughout our bodies, and the suits draw out and amplify that chi to the levels you saw today."

"Okay... That's TMI..." Jake uttered.

"Sounds like magic to me." Sally quipped.

"Hey, any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." the alien responded.

Jake turned back to her and asked, "Now, if you believe us, there's just a couple more questions to ask. One, can you find our mirror? If not, we're stuck here forever. Also, what's your name? We can't just keep calling you 'alien,' now can we?"

"Well, I could, but I'd need the base computer for that. My suit scanners aren't equipped to scan for eleven dimensional anomalies. Also, my name is Merido."

"Well, let's go then..." Jake says, walking up to her.

"Alright. The others should be back at base by now..." Merido says.
142331.title: Friendly aliens to the rescue!!!

1423311.content:
They all went back to the Neju base, since they didn't want to be ambushed again. Fortunately for them the return to base was uneventful and they arrived safely. "You'll be safe for now." Merido responded. Just as she predicted the other Neju had returned to base. " Feel free, to take a look around, you may find some Humans around here that are helping as well." She said. Jake and Sally nodded. The Neju base was unlike anything they have ever seen before. While Jake and Sally were awestruck by the Neju's base design, Merido was meeting with the other three who had returned.

"This place is amazing Jake, It looks like something you'd find in a Science Fiction movie." Sally said. " I know, it's amazing but I want to get out of this reality as quickly as possible. The longer we stay the more chance of us becoming pets to the Ferrions. " Jake reminded Sally. " You saw these four in action today though Jake, I'm sure they can handle just about anything that comes there way." She responded. As Sally and Jake were walking through the corridor of the Neju base, they both saw there parents at the base. "Is that who I think it is?" Jake asked.

" I think it is Jake. It's Mom and Dad!" Sally said. " Thank God, there night pets to the Ferrions!" Jake exclaimed with a sigh of relief. Jake and Sally rushed to the room so they could quickly meet with there parents.
1423311.title: They head to the Neju base...

choices: "...being moved to an orbiting Ferrion station as we speak!!"
14233112.content:
"Where were you?!" a contralto voice bellowed out at Merido.

"I had to protect the humans from the blast wave of the Armageddon System, Arbiter Kikader!!" she answered.

"Why didn't you come straight back? You know we have to stick together, and are vulnerable apart." the same voice spoke, coming from the one wearing the blue light contrails over her suit, possessing long white hair in a ponytail.

"These particular humans... they're not from this universe!!"

"Wait?! How can that be? The Multiverse Law..." Kikader exclaimed.

"They said they used a special mirror, which they believe got separated from them in mid-transit."

"A mirror, eh?" the Neju in pink says, calico tail thrashing, "I don't like it. Sounds hinky to me. Could they be some kind of Ferrion made human replicant or brainwashed human?"

The Neju in silver, possessing very long pink tresses, begged in a sweet innocent tone, "Lanmei, why do have to be so mean and distrusting all the time? I don't think little kids have a reason to lie. For shame." She turns away from Lanmei and pouts.

"Oooooh, Ri, time's like this I can't stand you!! I prefer you blowing shit up!! You're too sweet and kind-hearted to be using such giant guns!!" Lanmei fired back.

Ri blushed and she tapped her index finger together, saying, "But what's wrong with being nice?"

"You're a warrior!!" Lanmei screamed back, arms down, her short yellow hair swishing ever so slightly to her motions.

"Enough!!" Kikader appears between them in a flash. "Now, while you two were squabbling, I decided to let Merido scan for that mirror. A simple scan won't hurt anyone."

"Scanning for eleven dimensional incursion devices..." As she began a sweep across the globe, using hidden sensors across the planet, she detected a signal. "I found it!!"

"No way!!" Lanmei blurted.

"It's..."
14233112.title: Meanwhile With Merido

choices: "No... I'm fighting that thing!! Our counterparts are there too!!"
"GYYAAAAHH!! I know... But it isn't fair..." *Goes through the warp*
142331122.content:
"Well, what are we standing around here for? We can't let that mirror to get away from us and fall in their hands, now can we?" Kikader shouted. "Ri, Lanmei, you're with me!! Merido, you're our eyes and ears in case reinforcements come up, and given the gravity of this artifact, no doubt they'll pull no punches."

"Right!!"

"Right!!"

"Right!!"

The three Neju soared off out a chute and into the sky, heading for the utmost reaches of our atmosphere. Meanwhile, Merido was looking at the supercomputer with diligence when she heard the doors behind her open.

"Who!! Wha?! Who goes there?!" she blurts, startled by the intrusion. She then sees Jake and Sally there, along with their parents. "Oh guys, it's you. Don't scare me like that!!" She then says, "I would talk some, but we're on an important op, and I have to keep my eyes peeled for Ferrion reinforcement and hyper jump signals."

"It won't take long... but could you see if you could figure out where this universe's Jake and Sally are?" Jake asked her. "I wouldn't feel right leaving this universe without returning our counterparts to their parents."

Merido fought with her conscience and her sense of duty... "But I have no time... alright... I can run a search in a minimized window..." She pulls up a search engine to run a passive scan for them so she could reserve her focus on the galactic radar.

Up in near space, Lanmei was ripping through the Ferrion vessels and units with her pink energy blades as Kikader zipped around, smashing through the capital vessels blocking the way.

"You'd think their defenses would be tighter. Think it's a trap?"

"Why must everything be a trap? Can't we just be having a good day, Lanmei?" Ri said in her usual pleasant tone.

"I'm likely to agree with Lanmei on this one. Keep your eyes peeled." Suddenly a giant swarm of fighter drones springs out from behind the moon. "Like that!!" Kikader leans back pointing her left leg at the armada, then extends her right leg and tail perpendicular to the rest of her as she lifts her arms up to her sides. "Activate: Galactic Pirouette Assassin!!" Blue energy swirls from her wrists, ankles, and near the tip of her tail and she begins to rotate clockwise. A tornado of blue power sweeps out from the spinning vortex of her right leg and tail as a central bolt of blue lightning flies from her left foot. The giant tornado beam strikes the swarm of drones, beginning to destroy them left and right, and even causing indirect collateral damage to the nearby moon as the lightning creates an orb in the center of the enemy. Then flames shoot from her wrists as she launches forward, and as she neared the dwindling enemy, bladed ribbons of energy spun from her wrists. "You said you liked me when I was 'blowing shit up.' You approve, Lanmei?" Ri giggles in that same innocent tone.

"It's okay, I can get out of this." Jake thought as he walked towards the mirror.

Suddenly, he felt a tingling sensation all across his body.
"Oh no." Jake tried to say, but couldn't, the tingling force was keeping his mouth shut.
Jake looked in horror as the skin on his fingers began to dissolve and be immediately replaced by some sort of metal substance. His fingernails became some sort of hard plastic. He could feel his legs begin to fuse together, and his face started to rearrange itself.

Jake started to breath really hard as he collapsed against the wall. Something was very wrong. In under a minute, his eyes began to see the entire color spectrum differently, as his head began to be filled with numbers, equations and information that he never contemplated before.

Jake leaned forward, and noticed his body glided in that direction. As he looked down, he noticed that a sphere molded itself under his feet, he could balance on it perfectly.

Jake rolled up to the mirror, and saw a strange feminine looking robot staring back at it. Her long hair had miniature cords at the end of them. Her legs and hips looked like a skirt. As she turned around, she noticed a panel over her rectum. Was it for excreting used fluids? She had one on the front area too, but it seemed to be locked shut.

It looked like she had metallic breasts too, "what purpose did they serve?" she wondered.

Her face was odd. It clearly mimicked a human female's exaggerated features. between her lips was a voice-box, that looked like an intercom. Her eyes were glowing blue and three times larger than the average humans. She could feel the cameras and sensors behind the blue lens, recording and analyzing everything she saw. She had a nose too, but it seemed ornamental.
154131222.title: Jakes Metallic Transformation

choices: Jake is able to control her movements
Jake is taken to one of her transformed friends
1541312221.content:
Jake's eyes showed a display in her mind that connected her to some electronic database.
By only thinking the words, Jake could ask questions to it.
"Query: Source of Virus" Jake thought.
"Classified, level 4 clearance required." the database responded. "Searching identity...Confirmed. Model F-12 query. Access granted."

Jake saw all the information get downloaded into her mind. The virus was a terraforming device by an alien species who had decided to one day use Earth as their new home. The problem was that they were silicone based, and couldn't survive too much exposure to carbon based life.

The Technoganic Virus, as it was dubbed by scientists, was a disease that transformed all living tissue into metallic objects. It was really a bunch of self-replicating nanobots that would rearrange elements on an atomic level and adapt them to help adapt the world.

The virus adapted to become airborne, taking over most of the world within a year. Although some humans had an immunity to it.

As she consumed more information, Jake realized why he now had a feminine figure. In order to maintain the new ecosystem, humans were converted into drones and acted like white blood cells. Most humans became male drones. Ones that were unable to think, and could only respond to commands and protect themselves. They lost the ability to think, but were generally stronger, and produced more power.

The female drones, who almost looked identical to Jake, were like queens of miniature hives. Each one controlling 20 to 50 male drones. They were tasked with ensuring the male drones did their job, but seemed to have the freedom to act and think on their own as long as it didn't hinder or slow the terraforming process. The female drones were some of the first to be adapted, as they watched the virus work slower on the population, turning them into the male sub-class of drones. Apparently the virus made the first infected look more lady-like in order make the process seem less threatening. It was alien logic.

"Query: Today's activities" Jake thought.
"Searching...answer. 1) oversee drone process. 2) recharge 3) fix any problems that may arise." the database answered.

Before Jake could think, the sphere (which she thought of as a wheel,) propelled her towards the stairs.
1541312221.title: The origin of the Virus

15413122212.content:
Jake's body started moving on it's own, it must have been following it's basic commands. Jake focused her thoughts and found that she could at least control the speed of where she was going. Although the faster she went, the more a little bar in the side of her internal vision dropped.

Her city block was barely recognizable as she went down the street. Her neighbors had almost all turned into mindless male bots. Mr. & Mrs. Smith were two male bots creating some sort of structure. The whole Johnston family were also drone workers. They only way Jake could recognize them was that her scanner popped up their original identities in her head.

"Maybe is I make my rounds quicker, I'll be able to return to the mirror quicker." Jake thought as she increased her speed to full.

An hour later, Jake's body turned around and started heading towards her home. Her inspection came up with no issues, and she ordered herself to return to her room.

Suddenly, Jake's vision began to flicker. "WARNING: LOW POWER" her vision flashed at her. Jake panicked, and made a mad run towards her house. "Error." the word popped up.

Suddenly the sphere she traveled on stopped.
"Awaiting drone recharge." her vision flashed.

A rather large drone moved towards her. Her vision told her it was her friend Mike. Mike and Jake had grown up together, been in the same class and all of the same sports teams.

As Mike approached, the words "PREPARE FOR RECHARGE" popped up in her head.

The panel in her front popped open. Jake leaned over to look at it, there was a small socket that lighted up. As Jake looked at Mike slow down, a similar panel in his front popped open. A long robotic rod popped out and directed itself towards Jake's socket.

"No, not Mike!" Jake thought, as she realized how she'd be recharged.

"Model F-12: Override power transfer, initiate reserves." Jake ordered.
"Denied." was the response.
"Model F-12: To Drone/Mike: Abort"
"Denied." Jake's vision told her.

Mike slowed to a crawl to avoid any damage and soon his rod entered Jake's socket.
"RECHARGING" the words said in Jake's vision.

Jake felt a pleasurable buzz run through his waist and spread through the rest of his system.
"RECHARGED" the words said after 20 minutes.

Soon, Jake rolled towards the mirror in his room.
"Oh Mirror of Reality, grant me my desire that I seek to travel to another reality!" Jake's speaker's buzzed.

The mirror glowed an eerie blue and Jake rolled towards it.
"The next universe has got to be better than this one." Jake thought.

15423.content:
Jake rolls out of the portal, landing on his butt. Suddenly, tumbling out behind him was Sally, rolling into the wall. "Sally!! You followed me?!"

"When you first said the mirror was a gateway to other realities, I didn't believe you, but when that portal thingy showed up, I knew I'd be in trouble if I let you wander off into some god-knows parallel universe... Speaking of which..." Sally tells you, getting up.

"It looks like my room, but a little taller..." you say. Just then, two people burst into the room.

"Quick, grab the..." screamed a tall girl that looked like your best friend Allison from the hips up, but from the hips down under her short skirt, she looked like a miniature Brachiosaurus, a sort of Brachio-taur.

"You jerks!!" exclaimed the other girl, a spitting image for Sally's friend Jess, but has a Stegosaurus' tail swishing behind her, and was three feet taller than the friend Sally knew. "How dare you trick us like that!!"

"Say what now?" you say.

"I bet all those funky lights from that mirror was just some trick you guys set up in advance to mess with us." the sort of Allison said.

"I'm confused here." Sally asked. "What are we talking about here? we just got here, and we're already talking with weird freaky versions of our friends..."

"Freaky?!" the girl that kinda looks like Jess belts out enraged.

"You're... You're scaring me..." Sally cried, backing up defensively.

Before anything can escalate, though, Allison puts her tail in the way. "Something's not right, Jess. The Sally we know never got that scared when you blew your cool..." Upon hearing that, reason seemed to come back to the stego-girl's face.

"It worked, didn't it?" Jess uttered.

"Then, where's our Jake and Sally?"

You and Sally look at one another in confusion, then simultaneously ask, "Where are we?!"

Over the next few hours, Jess and Allison explain their universe, and you explain yours, and what each of you were doing before using the mirror. "So your species are called 'reprimates?'" you ask.

Allison says, "Yeah... A small meteor hit the Earth 65,000,000 years ago and lowered the Earth's ambient temps. It forced the dinosaurs to evolve, taking forms that were smaller, and allowed the evolution of endothermic metabolisms in our ancestors. Over time, we evolved alongside the ancestors of your human race, but during the last two ice ages we became the more prolific sentient species."

"So humans exist here too?"

"Yeah," Jess says, "In fact, our Jake and Sally were humans as well. The human race lives alongside us reprimates, and recently equal civil rights were given to humans back in the '60's, but we used to not be so nice to them, even enslaving them in the past. Our United States even fought a Civil War over the slavery of humans in the 1860's..."

"So, dinosaurs didn't survive to evolve into reprimates, and become the dominant species on the planet?" Allison wondered.

"Nope. The meteor hit 65,000,000 years ago, but ours was much bigger, killed all your ancestors in our world, nearly took all life with it, but then mammals became dominant and then primates, and now humans."

Sally says, "I don't want to sound rude, but I'm amazed how human-like you look, I mean, for evolving from dinos... Man I sound so shallow..."

Jess growls a little, but then relaxes, saying, "That last part was a little rude, but I'll let it go since you aren't from this universe and didn't know better."

Allison leads everyone over to Jake's computer as explains as she pulls up a webpage showing pics of various reprimates, and a anatomical medical chart, "I believe we gained simialr trait by living in similar conditions alongside humans in primordial times, but as you can see, there are some differences." She points to the screen, at a female. "As Sally noticed, female reprimates look more like humans than reptiles or dinosaurs, often the only differences being that we're about twice as tall as humans, and usually just have a dino tail. Some races have 'taur-like traits, like myself, while the female reprimates that evolved from pterodactyls and pterodons have wings in addition to tails." She then points to a more reptilian being, saying, "...and these are our males. As you can see, our males heavily favor our reptilian and dinosaur lineage, some having snouts, some not, but all having claws, digititrade legs, and scales over their entire body. A recent trend some old people don't get that some of the more effeminate males, or metrosexuals, as we call them, do is to wear wigs. Some believe it's because they get jealous of humans and female reprimates' smooth skin and ability to grow long luscious hair."

Everyone laughed. After talking about this world's Jake & Sally, you realize, outside of living alongside evolved dinos, they weren't too different from you two.

"So, your Jake and Sally invited you guys to watch and see them off, did they?" you said.

"Yeah. They activated that weird mirror with some mantra and then, BAM!! Gone." Jess said. "We looked for your folks, but they had just stepped out for groceries, so we ran back up here, and then ran into you guys."

"Wanna come with us?" you exclaim, slyly. "I figure I should of asked my best friend to come with me, but since I don't know how to get home just yet, why not take my best friend from another universe with me across the multiverse until we find that realm my aunt spoke of?"

"Wha... What...?!" Allison blurted, just in time for you to declare the mantra again.

Just then...

Suddenly, Jake heard a female voice echoing around him. "Human, I must thank you for freeing my soul. Although us dragons can die just like everything else on Earth, we can also have ourselves become reborn only if a human of a pure heart passes by us. That is why we choose you. Your heart is the purest heart that I have ever seen. So, I am offering you a gift: I am giving you a chance to become who I once was, and because of this, you will give our race a chance. Farewell human, and may you live far beyond the 10,500 years that I have lived," the female voice told Jake.

Suddenly, Jake passed out, and the next thing he saw when he woke up was a forest. He sat up straight, and he checked his surroundings. On his right was a pond of fresh water that has not been tainted by any human activity. As he drank the water, he saw his reflection. He (who is now a she) was a 10 foot tall Anthro Dragoness with golden scales covering her body. Her wing span was 25 feet when fully measured at the widest point. What does Jake do now?

Going with the Bending route, huh? Can't blame you on that choice. After all, having control of one of the four basic elements at your fingertips can be very....tempting.

Now then, to give our protagonist Jake some elemental Bending abilities, you must choose one of the 4 Bending Elements; Water, Earth, Fire, or Air. However, since this is an interactive story, we can spice up some things, like add in various different Bending elements, like say, turn a sub-skill from one of the 4 bending elements into a primary Bending skill.

So, what do you say?
1543322222222122111.title: Elemental Bending Powers of Your Choosing

choices: No thanks, how about we try another experimental Bending Power, huh?
15433222222221221112.content:
Well, talking about thinking outside the box. And speaking of outside the box, let's start off with something I would like to call 'Lightning-Bending'.

As for what this is, Lightning-Bending is where, as anybody can guess, someone can manipulate the high-voltage inducing element known as 'Electricity'. However, this isn't the same electricity that comes from modern-day electric generators, oh no. Instead, this element will come from only one natural force of nature; Lightning Storms.

Originally, this form of Bending came from the two sub-skills in Firebending, Lightning generation & Lightning redirection. As the name implies, Lightning generation allows a Firebender to create & guide a bolt of lightning from their very fingertips. However in physical terms, generating lightning involves the bender to move their arms in circular motions, guiding the lightning's direction rather forcefully controlling it. Those who mastered this sub-skill are capable of generating lightning at extremely high speeds, making it slightly deadlier than any other form of Bending, especially if someone is using or wearing something metallic in their possession. Those who are able to use Lightning generation include Fire Lord Ozai, Iroh, and of course, Princess Azula.

As for Lightning redirection, it is also a Firebending sub-skill, only it allows a Firebender to absorb the lightning into their body as energy and release the electric energy toward a more desirable direction. This technique was developed by Iroh after he studied Master Waterbenders redirecting force rather than oppose it head-on. Lightning redirection works equally well for both natural & generated lightning. Only three individuals were capable of redirecting lightning; Iroh, Zuko, and the Avatar himself, Aang.

However, since our protagonist Jake will have this sort of experimental Bending, his body will be able to generate and use massive amounts of this high-voltage element of nature, basically making him a walking human Mega-Generator. Plus, both Lightning generation & Lightning redirection will both work into this new type of Bending.

So, ready to ride the lightning, Jake?"

1543322222222222221.content:
Jake stepped through the mirror …

… and found himself in a wide open field of yellow-gold wheat, growing thick and waving gently back and forth in the breeze.

“Where am I?” he asked.

Except the words that came from his tongue rolled out effortlessly in Latin.

“I can't speak English anymore?” Jake asked himself, again in fluent Latin.

Taking a few steps through the wheat field, Jake quickly discovered he was now clad in a short, white tunic and a pair of sandals. A small metal disk hung on a loose fitting, thin, leather necklace dangling about his throat.

What sort of strange world was this?

After wading through the apparently neverending wheat field for almost a quarter of an hour, Jake finally stumbled across his first signs of civilization in this strange, new world: a rickety, wooden platform built up next to a set of railroad tracks.

“This is so bizarre,” Jake said to himself. “I can't speak English anymore. I'm wearing a toga. And here I am, standing on a wooden platform in the middle of nowhere, apparently waiting for a train!”

As if on cue, Jake heard the far off whistle and distant rumble of an approaching train.

“Well, I can't leave this place until I find Aunt Diane's mirror again,” he muttered. “I may as well sit and wait for the train. I'm guessing it'll have to stop for boarding at this little whistle stop of a platform.”

Indeed as Jake sat and picked at the hem of his short, tunic-like toga, the train did indeed approach and begin to slow as it neared the platform he sat upon. As the engine chugged more slowly and gradually ground to a halt, Jake was able to pick out some words carefully stenciled in purple-red ink on the side of the train: “Nova Britannia Pneumaplaustra-CCCXIII”

As the steam engine halted, a bored looking soldier in a plumed helmet and breastplate casually jumped from the train onto the wooden platform. The man looked like an extra in an old costume drama movie about the Roman Empire … except the startling anachronism carried on his belt: a modern and very deadly looking handgun.

“Are you citizen, resident, or barbarian?” the soldier asked in a quiet, matter-of-fact fashion.

“Uh …” Jake stammered, not really knowing the answer.

“Come, come now,” muttered the soldier impatiently. “Just show me you blasted identification. This train has schedules to keep, by Jupiter. I haven't got all day.”

Playing a hunch, Jake lifted the metal disk attached to his necklace and held it up for the soldier to see.

“Ah, very good!” said the soldier squinting at the metal disk.

1543322222222222222222221.content:
Jake fell flat on his face as he exited through the mirror and into this new reality. As he was about to get up however he was pushed down by his own sister who had followed him through the mirror. So far he hadn't seen any of this reality or knew anything about it. He then got up after his sister Sally got up.

" Sally, what are you doing here?" he asked.

" When that mirror thing of yours started to work I got a bit worried. So I came to make sure you would be okay." Sally said. As Jake looked around he noticed that it didn't look like his room yet the picture told otherwise. The room instead somehow felt smaller and looked as if it was dealt with less care. This Jake had no computer or any electronics in his room, but he did have a book on history at his shelf.

" That book, it looks like a history book, maybe it can help us understand this world better." Jake suggested.

" A history book, it would be easier if this version of you had a computer." Sally said. Jake then began to read the book and saw Sally showed much more interest in the book once she learned of this worlds history. According to this world Women were always dominant over men, since Ancient times. In fact the book even described that in Ancient times women were worshiped as gods because of their ability to give birth. Much of that worship today however was diminished mostly due to some people using that worship for evil and other nefarious things. Several other things were mentioned such as many of the people who were famous men in your reality were in fact woman. Of course there were also some major differences as well.

You looked around the room once more after finishing the book and noticed that the mirror was gone! " Sally, the Mirror it's gone!" You said.

" I guess we are stuck here then. I kind of like this reality though Jake what about you?" Sally asked.

" I just go here so I have no reason to hate it yet, but who knows that could change." Jake replied. The two of you then exited your room where you both saw your mother of this reality for the first time. From looking at your mother you could tell that she was someone important in the city. However your mother surprises you when she tells you.....
