choices: Jake and Thomas explore their body
15433222222222222222222221221.content:
The moment Jake stepped through the mirror, a wave of drowsiness swept over him, and he struggled to remain conscious. He would have fallen over if he was not already lying down. "What?" Jake tried to speak. He lifted his head from a pillow but quickly regretted it. His world began to spin, and he quickly fell back against the pillow again. "What... what is going on?" Jake had a difficult time formulating his thoughts. His mind was cloudy. Jake strained his brain to figure out where he was. The lights in the room were dim, but despite this and his groggy state, he could tell that this was not his bedroom. "Where?" he tried to speak, but his voice was rough. Jake realized his throat was dry and painful.

"You're not supposed to be waking up yet." An unknown voice said from somewhere in the room.

"I told you that the sedative was not going to be strong enough." A different voice answered. "Let's up the dosage before they both wake up and accidentally hurt themselves."

Thats when Jake noticed an IV attached to his left arm. And he also became aware of a dull, throbbing pain down the length of his torso. "I'm in a hospital?" He tried speaking, but whomever was in the room did not respond, probably not hearing him. Jake could barely hear himself speaking. He slowly turned his head, to try and see who the voices belonged to. All he could make out was a blurry figure adjusting something on a machine. His question went unanswered as he drifted off into unconscious bliss.

Jake drifted to and from conscious several times over what he surmised were the next several days, though he had no idea how much time had really passed. His only clue was the light that poured in from the single window in the hospital room. Sometimes it was strong sunlight, like from the middle of the day. Other times, little to no light came in, as if it were night. Finally though, he did begin to wake from his drug induced state.

His eyes slowly opened to a more lit room. Jake carefully wiped the sleep from his eyes, careful not to tug too hard on the IV still attached to his left arm. Jakes' mind was still cloudy from the drugs in his system, but he knew things felt off, different. He tilted his head to look down. At first glance, his body seemed normal. A thick blanket covered him up to his navel. A thinner sheet was laid comfortably up to his neck. Despite his drugged state, he figured that this reality's version of him just had surgery. He carefully pulled back the sheet to see if there was a scar. There was none, or no scars anymore. At first, he could not wrap his mind around it, still probably due to the drugs making his mind work slow. He just stared at his chest, or half of his chest. It looked like his left torso had been attached to a different person's right torso. He placed his left hand in the middle of his chest. While he could feel his whole chest with his left hand, he could only feel the touch of his palm on the left portion of his chest. He drummed his fingers along the right side of his ribcage but he felt no sensation from that side. The gravity of the situation did not immediately effect him until he noticed something attached to the top of the right shoulder. There was a second neck and a second head. His skin began to prickle at the wrongness of it. Jake quickly sobered, feeling the extra weight of a second, unconscious head.

He would have screamed, but his throat was still raw. Instead his breathing and heart rate began to rise as panic filled his veins. "What the fuck world, what reality am I stuck in!" He thought. Immediately, he felt it become harder to breathe. He looked at the unconscious teen beside him, whose breathing was slower. He could feel his lungs inflate and deflate irregular, like they were struggling to obey two different wills. "Do we share lungs?" Jake thought. He focused on the other head's breathing, trying to slow his to match. It worked. His breathing, their breathing synchronized, and he no longer felt like he might pass out.

He tried to keep a level head as he peered downward, trying to ignore the other person he was attached to for the moment. Jake instead attempted to determine which parts of his body are actually his. He could feel his left arm, his left leg, his side, his neck and half his chest. But that was it, the rest of him might as well be paralyzed. "What the fuck!" His voice was rough. "I-I need to get out of here. I need to get the mirror." He tried to sit up but moved nowhere. The unresponsive right side of his body kept him down. "Stupid." Jake said to himself. He clearly could not go anywhere by himself. Jake forced himself to take several deep breathes to calm himself down. He reminded himself of his Aunt's message about the mirror. That this, whatever this was, could be undone, hopefully. He had to believe that or risk begin panicking again.

Someone coughed, drawing Jake's attention. He turned to the only other person in the room, as the other teenage boy began to wake. He could not help but stare as the other head slowly opened his eyes and wiped the sleep from his eyes. The other boy licked his lips and cleared his throat. Jake could hear him part his lips and breathe. When the other boy coughed again, Jake awkwardly jumped. The teen turned and for a moment had the same confused look Jake thought he must have had when he first awoke. The guy cleared his throat and said in a horse voice, "Uh... hey."

Jake managed to reply with a simple, "Hi."

"Did we..." He cleared his throat and started again. "Did we wake up about the same time? I know the doctors say that our hormones would need time to synchronise after the surgery." The other boy turned to look around the room.

The other boy did not seem panicked to see Jake. "Um... I only awoke a couple of minutes earlier." Jake answered.

"Oh good." The other boy gave him a half smile. "It would have sucked if one of us did not wake up around the same time as the other."

"Right..." Jake replied. "Um... I'm Jake... by the way." He decided on introducing himself since he had no idea who he was stuck with.

"Yeah Jake, duh. We've only known each other since the Selection." The other boy smirked.

Jake did not know what he meant by 'the Selection.' But, he figured it was some major event in this reality. He was about to ask the teen his name, when he noticed a couple of balloons beside the bed. There were also several cards propped open on the counter beside him. Jake quickly read one that wished them a speedy recovery and it addressed them as "Jake and Thomas." He turned to the teen, "Uh Thomas..." Jake said, testing to make sure that was his name. The teen turned to look at him. "...uh how long have we been out, do you think?"

"The doctor said it would take a week before the healing was finished." Thomas said, matter of factly.

"Right..." Jake answered. "A week..."

"I'm sure we're healed enough to try and move. Want to get out of bed and see what we look like?" Thomas smiled, obviously believing this whole situation to be normal.

Jake had a million questions running through his head about the reality he was dumped into. But, he figured that asking those now would seem strange to Thomas. He would have to wait to get some of those answers. "Yeah, I am curious about... how we look." Jake replied, which was the truth.
15433222222222222222222221221.title: Waking from a Conjoinment Surgery

choices: Jake and Thomas check themselves in the bathroom
154332222222222222222222212211.content:
"I'm curious too." Thomas's dark brown eyes looked back. He said with a friendly smile. "I've heard from my brother that it can be a bit of a shock, despite all of the preparation and simulations we go through before the surgery."

Jake felt the muscles down the center of his abdomen clench, and he knew that Thomas was trying to sit up. Jake braced his forearm on the bed and pushed his side of their torso up. The bed sheet fell down around his waist, revealing their shared torso and a single belly button. Underneath the blanket, Jake could see the outline of only two legs, and only one was his. The sight made him hold his breathe. It was completely alien. The right side of his body clearly belong to his other boy; the skin tone was a light brown which contrasted with Jake's paler, white skin. Down the center of their torso, their individual skin colors blended seamlessly. The body had no scars or stitches, no indication that they had ever been separate people originally.

"I know... it is weird... seeing only one body." Thomas said, beside him. Jake watched in silence as Thomas used his hand to throw the blanket off. Jake was thankful that they happened to be wearing a pair of white underwear, which hid what was between their legs. Both trying to ignore that portion for now, he and Thomas then kicked the rest of the blanket off. Jake stared at the other boy's foot when Thomas flexed his toes.

Jake felt he was still in a dream, or maybe some kind of nightmare. His mind had a hart time processing what he was seeing. "I guess we should get out of bed." He finally said out loud, turning his neck to face Thomas. The other boy nodded in agreement. Slowly, they rotated their hips and let their legs dangle off the side. "Let's take it really slow. I still have an IV in my arm." Jake says as his eyes trace the tubbing up to a clear bag. It hung from a metal pole with two hooks.

The door to the room suddenly swung open. "We see that you are awake." A familiar voice stated. Thomas's head blocked Jake's vision so he could not see who had stepped in, but he did not have to wait long. The person walked around the room, coming into his line of sight. Jake tried his best not to look shocked. The persons, the doctors, who came into the room were joined to a single body, just like Thomas and he were. They wore a stereotypical white coat with a light blue collard shirt underneath. "I don't think they need that IV anymore." The head on the left said, facing towards his counterpart. "Mind if we help you with this." The other head said to Jake. All he could do was nod.

Incredibly coordinated, the two-headed doctor began to unhook Jake's arm from the IV bag. "Hold your arm up, just like that." The one on the right said as his other half placed a gauze pad where the needle had been. "How are you feeling?" The doctor on the left said, apparently to both Jake and Thomas.

"Fine." Thomas answered. "Just getting used to this is all." Thomas did not appear to be as fascinated by how coordinated the doctors were as Jake was, but he figured that Thomas was probably used to this though.

Both doctors nodded. "It will take some time for you to adjust to the newness of your body, but that is typical for everyone after the surgery. Just be careful when walking around." The doctor on the left replied. They were now finishing with securing a roll of gauze around Jake's arm to keep the pad in place. "There are some clothes in the bathroom that should fit you. Let the nurses know if they do not, or if you have any symptoms like nausia." With the brief check-up appearing to be over, the doctors left the room and let the door close behind them.

Jake's and Thomas's bare feet were still dangling off of the bed. "I guess we should go into the bathroom to get dressed." Thomas said to him.
154332222222222222222222212211.title: A brief doctor visit

choices: Jake and Thomas explore the hospital
1543322222222222222222222122111.content:
Jake nodded his head and on the count of three, he and Thomas slid off of the bed, landing on their two feet. Jake immediately felt a difference in his center of gravity. "It feels like I'm going fall over to my right." Jake voiced his thoughts out loud. "But I'm not because its like I'm leaning against..." He paused, unsure how to articulate the strange sensation.

"An invisible wall." Thomas said, finishing Jake's thought. "I feel the same thing, well almost the same thing. It feels like I might topple over to the left at any time." Thomas smiled sheepishly. "Um... I guess we should each take a step." Thomas was staring at both his and Jake's feet expectantly.

"Okay..." Jake responded hesitantly before lifting his foot from the ground. It was like he was hovering off the ground. He had not sensation of the support Thomas provided. His other half's leg provided supported their weight for the few moments it took for Jake to place his foot forward a step. One second after his foot touched the ground, Thomas lifted his own foot. Jake had the forethought to brace the muscles in the one leg he had so as not to cause them to fall over.

Slowly, step by step, they walked towards the bathroom. Jake knew that if he was not sharing a body, he would have made it to the bathroom, relieved himself, washed his hands, and trudged back to the hospital bed in the same time it took Thomas and him to cross the room. When they finally made it to the open bathroom door, Jake held onto the frame for support. It was surprisingly tiring to maneuver a body when you only controlled half of it.

Going all the way in, Thomas blindly flipped a switch on the wall, turning the light on. Inside the small, windowless bathroom was a simple toilet, sink, small shelf, and full-body mirror. Both Jake and Thomas paused to look at themselves.

Jake had to force himself to breathe. It was completely disorienting to see their reflection staring back, the image of what for all intents and purposes was a two-headed boy. Just as he had seen from his brief examination before, a single torso, comprised of two used-to-be separate halves, were joined down the middle seamlessly. There was no defining line or ugly scar that bisected them. Jake's white, lightly tanned skin simply blended in the middle with Thomas's darker, toffee colored skin. More surprisingly since Jake did not play sports in school, he realized that their body appeared to be athletically built with a lean stomach. He caught himself staring in awe and wonder at this alien body he shared, rather than feeling terror.

"Want to help me dress ourselves?" Thomas said beside him. Jake turned to face him, realizing that he was trying to reach the clothes that were left on the shelf.

Jake turned with him to face the shelf and reached his hand for the clothes. He stopped and brought his hand back to his side of their hips. "Actually, lets see what our... you know what... looks like." Jake knew that there was only one hanging between their legs; he had felt it brush against a thigh he could not feel as well as his own. But, he still needed, wanted to see it. Thomas obliged, helping him pull down their underwear which fell around their ankles. Their blended skin tones proved to stretch over their entire body, from between their necks, down their chest and back, in between their shared butt, and down the length of their single penis and testicles. Jake did not quite recognize the penis as his own, since it obviously was some kind of combination of both of theirs. Jake turned to Thomas, "Okay, now we can get dressed." He said; Jake's curiosity was satisfied.
1543322222222222222222222122111.title: Jake and Thomas check themselves in the bathroom

15433222222222222222222222221121.content:
Jake looked deep into the mirror. There was something odd about the next world. It was beautiful, and looked rather ... rural. The colours just looked a little too vibrant and clear. But it didn't look too dangerous.

The surface of the mirror rippled as he put his hand through. As his face approached, he closed his eyes and held his breath.

Feeling a sense of dislocation, he raised a hand to his head until he felt the dizziness pass.

Letting his breath out with a long slow gasp, he prepared to open his eyes.

It was cold... the air chilling his lungs, making him want to cover more of his skin.

The realisation hit him like a hammer. His eyes snapped wide open, and he looked at his body...

He was female, the bare arms, the length of hair at his shoulder, and the weight... the unfamiliar weight pulling at his shoulders were her clues...

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736...

Jake's surprise was trumped, when without warning, she felt a -whump- of displaced air, and turned to see a ferocious creature at her shoulder. The fierce yellow eyes, that mouth full of teeth.

A shrill cry... high and feminine came without effort.

The animal just nuzzled against her like a favourite pet. She stood powerless to flee, as it rubbed against her cheek to cheek. Tentatively she raised a hand and scratched it under the chin.

A loud, deep purring noise came from it. Like a cat, but scaled up to a much nearer a growl. She took the time to admire the creature. Now she felt her life wasn't in imminent danger. It was a dragon... an honest to God dragon. She looked it over from head to tail... there wasn't any other way to describe it.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736...

She had a 'pet dragon', Jake felt a smile fill his face. The proximity of the dragon warming her as she felt the world spin around her, as she tried to adjust to a world where she was ... a she... and she ... she had a dragon.
15433222222222222222222222221121.title: 'How to Train Your Dragon' world.

15522.content:
Big shock number one occurred as Jake immediately fell to the floor as he passed through the mirror.

“What the heck?” he mumbled, rising to his feet.

The room around him was completely different now. For one thing, all the furnishings had completely disappeared. Jake was simply sprawled out across a sparse, barren floor. The room itself was smaller than before, but well lit and quite clean.

As Jake rose to his feet, he discovered the next big shock of this strange new reality.

He was a girl.

He was also a considerably shorter, thinner person than he had been. The color of his skin seemed to have deepened as well. He was now wearing a long, navy skirt, a pair of white, loose fitting knee socks, and black maryjanes. A sailor-style white blouse with a red tie was on over his torso. Jake could feel long, straight hair brushing against the back of his neck as he looked about examining his new self.

“Why am I a girl now?” he whispered.

Then he discovered big shock number three.

Jake was no longer speaking English. The words that came from his lips, in fact the very words that composed his thought processes right now, were Japanese – not English.

And as soon as he had uttered something aloud in this strange tongue that he suddenly spoke with the fluency of a native, Jake had become fully aware of the non-English nature of his words.

“I'm in some weird, parallel universe where … what? I'm a Japanese schoolgirl?!” he muttered, staring down at the skirt wrapped about his legs and the tiny but firm, perky breasts pushing up from beneath his sailor's blouse.

“I've got to find Aunt Diane's mirror in this reality and use it to get someplace else,” he said to himself.

As he prepared to leave the room though, Jake happened to spot something that immediately kindled his interest. A textbook sat neatly propped up in the corner of the room, as though someone here had just been studying from it. The title read: Hokubei-ken no zukai no rekishi – The Illustrated History of the North American Prefectures.

“What sort of strange new world is this?” wondered Jake.

Figuring he could always go off in search of Aunt Diane's mirror (or its equivalent in this reality) at some later point, Jake sat down with what presumably was his own school book and started reading.

Evidently, in this version of reality the United States of America no longer existed as Jake remembered it. The nation was now called Kitaamerikashu and was a puppet state controlled, just like the rest of the western hemisphere, by Imperial Japan. The former United States was now populated by the descendants of several waves of wealthy Asian settlers who had re-colonized North America, seizing it from the Americans in much the same way as European settlers had taken the land from the Native Americans. Caucasians were now poor second-class citizens in this strange, new world. Having come from an educated, middle class family before, the only way Jake could have maintained a semblance of his prior life was to have been transformed into someone of Japanese heritage.

“And apparently a girl, too!” he laughed, again looking down at himself, this time with more humor than shock. He sat in a most unladylike fashion, with his legs comfortably spread wide on the floor and his skirt draped between, almost like a blanket. He might have been granted the ability to speak Japanese in this new reality, but he had certainly not gained any of his analog's feminine poise or mannerisms.

Jake continued to read more and more, becoming thoroughly engrossed in this weird, alternate history, delving deeper into the timeline of the textbook he read.

Japan and Germany had won World War II. That much came as no great surprise by this point. The Nazis had conquered all of Europe with the exception of Italy. The Italians in turn ruled North Africa and the rest of the Mediterranean. The Japanese somehow had seized not just all of Asia but the entire western hemisphere!

As Jake plunged deeper and deeper into this new version of history, he finally came across what he believed was the fracture line that differentiated this world from his home. Apparently on Feb. 15 of 1933 in this world, an assassin named Giuseppe Zangara had killed Franklin Roosevelt less than a month before the inauguration. FDR had never been president – never even been sworn in! He was just a historical footnote: a president-elect killed before day one on the job.

Without Roosevelt, the great depression lingered much longer and the succeeding presidents (John Nance Garner, Charles Lindbergh, Henry Wallace, and then someone called William Dudley Pelley) had all insisted on a strict policy of American Isolationism, refusing to be drawn into World War II – which apparently had dragged out much, much longer in this reality!

When Senator Robert Taft ran against President Pelley in 1948, there were widespread accusations of vote tampering having been responsible for Pelley's landslide reelection. Millions of Americans who knew they hadn't voted for Pelley took to the streets rioting over the alleged theft of the white house. The U.S. Army had even mutinied, refusing to obey President Pelley's commands to restore order through violence. When the army itself had failed to support the commander-in-chief, Pelley suddenly became interested in the ongoing World War. He invited Japanese occupation of the United States to restore order. Forty divisions of Japanese troops were shipped to America. And although a brief civil war had ensued, the Japanese had won and President Pelley's power had been cemented.

Only now, he owed allegiance to the Japanese.

World War II finally ended in 1950 when Dr. Yoshio Nishina perfected something called the Ni-Go Project – Japan's atomic bomb. It's successful use against a pair of small, Chinese towns marked the end of World War II, as well as the end of any meaningful resistance in puppet states like America.

After the war, the U.S. Constitution had been repealed and the Third Continental Congress was convened to draft a new constitution. The result was Kitaamerikashu – the Union of North American Prefectures. The new nation was to throw its doors open to wealthy Japanese emigres, who would be given free homes and land as well as cushy government jobs in exchange for relocating to the new world.

The rest of history read like a strange, wonderland of Buck Rogers style science fiction with everything but flying cars! The new owners of America were wealthy, highly educated, technophiles who pushed grand, new industrial innovations upon their new homeland. High-speed monorails were built, electronics research was strongly funded, automated factories run by robots were produced, blazing fast computers were developed, space travel blossomed, and the world had quickly become a technological utopia.

The first satellites had gone up in 1953. Man had landed on the moon in 1959. Manned exploration of the asteroid belt had started in 1979. A plethora of permanently occupied space stations dotted Earth's orbit now, and seven small lunar cities existed in self-sufficiency on the surface of the moon.

Highly advanced holographic technology has become widespread, available for three-dimensional entertainment throughout the industrialized world much the way movies and television had been in Jake's own world. Likewise, vividly realistic virtual reality worlds were now possible thanks to the development of both ultra-fast computers and amazingly realistic holography.

The medical advances as well were astounding. A cancer cure had been developed back in 1973! Cloning techniques now enabled a severed limb to be re-grown. Genetic engineering advances had eliminated a host of a congenital diseases. The common cold still existed, but that seemed to be about the only disease this world hadn't yet eradicated!

“Maybe this world isn't so bad after all,” Jake said to himself … in Japanese, with a high-pitched girlish voice, he noted silently.

15533222222221.content:
Jake tumbled clumsily to the floor and lay there for a moment, struggling to catch his breath, balled up in a crumpled heap.

“Jake!” shrieked Sally. “Put down your dress. I don't want to see your panties! Sheesh, you're my brother.”

“What?!” exclaimed Jake, springing to his feet.

Sure enough, Jake was wearing a dress.

A long, frilly yellow sundress made out of some cheerful, floral print fabric.

“Why am I wearing a dress?” he asked.

“Because you always do,” sighed Sally, rolling her eyes.

Jake squinted at Sally to make sure his eyes weren't deceiving him.

She was dressed in a dirty t-shirt, blue jeans, and a ball cap. Obviously still female, Sally was now dressed like a tomboy.

Jake dashed to the mirror and gasped at his reflection. He was still physically male: an ordinary, sixteen-year old boy. Only now he had long hair hanging down a few inches past his shoulders, recently dyed blond from the looks of it. Tasteful makeup was applied to his masculine face: pale, pink lipstick alongside just a hint of silvery gray eyeshadow, blush, and a light coating of mascara to accentuate his long, girlish lashes. On his body was the aforementioned yellow sundress. Completely the outfit was a pair of wedge-heeled sandals on his feet.

“I always dress like this?” he asked Sally.

“No,” she said. “Sometimes you wear something more formal. That's just what you lounge around the house in. Jake, what's wrong with you today? You're being weird.”

“This mirror did it,” insisted Jake. “Tell me you remember about the mirror, Sally. About it coming from Aunt Diane. And it possessing magic properties?”

Sally slowly shook her head.

“Jake, maybe you'd better go lie down or something,” she said. “You're really being weird. I'm going to go get mom and dad to check on you.”

The moment Sally left, Jake began tossing his room upside down in an eager search for clues about all the other ways this universe differed from his own. Every book, every magazine, every newspaper seemed to confirm the same thing: this world was identical to Jake's own world, except that male and female fashion had been completely flipped around. Apparently, since time immemorial the clothing of men and women had been reversed in this world. In whatever decade or century Jake looked at, the fashions remained the same … only the men were clad in the skirts and dresses, while the women wore trousers and other male attire.

“On the surface, it's only one tiny, insignificant difference,” chuckled Jake. “It shouldn't make the slightest difference in the world whether a man wears pants or a skirt. And yet, here I am feeling like an absolute, raving lunatic for being dressed like this.”

All the possessions in Jake's bedroom were unchanged, indicating his hobbies, friends, interests, and outside life would largely be the same in this reality. Then Jake got to the closet: nothing but dresses, skirts, and fancy gowns. Likewise, his dresser was full of frilly blouses, cute tank tops and babydoll tees, some tight looking leggings, and of course a neatly packed row of panties and bras.

“Why would I even need to wear a bra?” Jake muttered, holding by his thumb and forefinger one of the lacy, alien-looking devices at arm's length. “It's not like I have boobs or anything.”
15533222222221.title: Sartorial Role Reversal

155332222222211.content:
Jake headed back to his computer to pull up the various social media sites he had accounts on to see just how much his own personal life was changed. But just as he was logging on, there was a bright flash followed by a thud. Jake turned around to see his sister Sally pulling herself up off the floor of his room dressed the same as she had been a minute ago but looking confused as if she didn't know where she was. "Jake, what's going on here?" She asked. "Why are we dressed this way?"

"Sally? Is, is that you? You followed me through the mirror?"

"No" Sally replied rather sarcastically. "I used the magic toilet"

"Very funny" Jake said as he turned back to hos computer.

"So, what's going on here. Why are we dressed this way?"

"Well" Jake started. "Based on the little research I've done so far, for as long as clothes have existed men's and women's clothes have basically been flip flopped. Guys have always worn skirts, dresses and other girly clothes while girls have worn pants and whatnot"

"Ok, so what now?"

"Well, I figured we could hang out in this universe for a bit" Jake said. "It's a relative small change in the big picture, plus we still have to find the mirror in this universe anyway so that'll probably take some time"

With that Sally walked out of Jakes room, clearly bothered by the fact that she would be for the time being dressing as a guy (or at least in her mind). As for Jake, he had more or less the same feeling. The thought of wearing a dress just felt so weird to him. But as he looked back at his computer he noticed that dinner was only a few hours away and it seemed pointless to change into something else that would make him more comfortable now. So after browsing through his Facebook Jake decided to head on downstairs and see what his family was up to. Walking was certainly different due to the heeled sandals that Jake was now wearing, and he decided to take them off rather than risk hurting himself by wearing them longer then he needed to. As he did, he noticed that his finger and toe nails were both painted red. And rather recently by the looks of it.

Walking down the hall and into the living room Jake was met by both his parents. His dad was currently wearing a yellow long sleeve tee shirt with a grey tank top underneath, a pair of blue jeans, and a pair of grey flats. His hair was still the same shade of brown and longer than it used to be, but short for what's considered normal for males now. As for his mom, well, she was dressed in clothes Jake would have expected his dad to wear. She was currently wearing a blue polo shirt with khaki shorts and a pair of white ankle socks with no shoes on. Her hair was cut very short, much like his dads used to be.

With his parents currently watching the evening news, and having no other plans of his own, Jake decided to join them in the living room. He sat down in one of the recliner chairs like he normally would have, until he remembered he was currently wearing a dress and had to adjust how he was sitting. Lucky, neither of his parents noticed. After about an hour or so Jakes mom got up off the couch and started heading towards the kitchen. She told Jake and his dad that dinner should be ready in about half an hour or so. Dinner, and the rest of the evening for a matter of fact, went by uneventfully as normal. The conversations were more or less the same, as was the food. In the end, Jake just decided to go to bed early. Once he was in his room he stripped out of the dress he had worn for most of today, along with the bra and panties, and slid on a pair of pink sleep shorts and a white tank top. He was about to crawl in bed when he remembered he was wearing makeup, so he sat down at a makeup station in his room and proceeded to do his best to remove it before crawling in his bed for the night.

Now the question is, what does Jake have going on tomorrow?

155332222222222221.content:
“Whoops!” Jake said, tumbling down to the floor after passing through the mirror.

Hmm, he thought. Everything here looks the same. His room was identical to the way it had been before … except … the mirror was gone! Did he really wind up in another place?

“What's your problem, doofus?” asked Sally.

“Huh?” asked Jake.

“Why are you sprawled out on the floor, upside down like that?” she asked. “What a weirdo.”

“Sally! Jake!” called mom from down the hall. “I need the two of you to go fetch Moses and Miriam.”

Okay this was new, thought Jake. Who the devil are Moses and Miriam?

“Uh, who is she talking about?” Jake asked his sister.

“Moses and Miriam,” answered Sally. “Oh, mom probably sent them to the corner store to get milk and the stupid, lazy slaves aren't back yet. It happens every time! I don't know why we even bother owning slaves. Mom always winds up making you and I do all the work after those lazy slaves …”

“What the hell!” Jake exclaimed, surprising even himself.

Sally was immediately silent.

“We own slaves?!” asked Jake. “When the hell did this happen?”

“We've always owned slaves,” Sally said with a casual shrug. “What's with you today? Moses and Miriam have been with the family since before you and I were born. Mom inherited them when nana passed away. They were shipped up here and been with us ever since.”

“I'm sorry, but they're slaves?” Jake repeated slowly. “That's horrible. That's revolting. That's absolutely evil. I think I'm going to be sick, Sally! No one should be a slave. I can't believe my own family practices slavery! We actually own a fellow human being? And treat them like property?! That's despicable.”

“Careful there,” Sally said slowly. “You're starting to sound like an abolitionist. What's with you today, Jake? You never cared about radical politics until today. You must have landed pretty hard on your head just now! Tell you what: I'll go track down Moses and Miriam. You get your head together and stop acting like such a space case.”

As Sally walked off, Jake busily began ransacking his room looking for clues as to what had happened. It didn't take long to discover a map of North America that identified two different countries: the United States of American and the Confederate States of America. Apparently, Jake's family lived south of the border in the CSA.

Next, Jake managed to find some school books from this new reality. It seemed that other than baseball, apple pie, and the English language, there were very few similarities between the USA and the CSA.

A three-thousand mile long border of concrete walls, razor wire, and military checkpoints separates the two nations. Richmond Virginia is the capital of the CSA. Southern gentlemen are dapper, cavalier men of honor. Women are all meant to be Southern Belles – beautiful, graciously courteous, and exceedingly feminine. Rock 'n Roll, having its roots among black rhythm and blues performers, never caught on in the CSA and remains a strictly “Yankee” cultural phenomena. The CSA celebrates bluegrass and blend of country and gospel, popularized by folk like Elvis Presley and Jerry Lee Swaggart. Life seems to be slow, relaxed, and strongly faith-based, but with a seething pot of unspoken racism, sexism, and prejudice bubbling just below the surface.

Technology is mostly the same, but with more emphasis on railroads or travel aboard a floating network of dirigibles that leisurely transported people and cargo across the continent. The real superpower of the world now was the German Empire. With no unified American military to aid in either of the Great War of 1914 or the succeeding Franco-German War, the Germans had triumphed early in the twentieth century and conquered all of Europe. They had spent the ensuing decades solidifying their rule and engaging in a space race with the Soviets. The Germans built the first permanent space station in 1972, a moon base in 1977, and landed men on Mars in 1983.

Neither of the Americas, by comparison, seems interested in a space program of any sort, content to merely engage in a perpetual cold war of paranoia. Each side had guns, cannons, and missiles trained on the other, not to mention networks of espionage agents working to undermine the opposition.

And this was now the world Jake and his family found themselves trying to live ordinary, mundane lives in.
155332222222222221.title: Look Away, Dixie Land!

1553322222222222221.content:
As Jake tumbled out, he suddenly felt something land on him. "I told you not to go!!"

"Sally?"

"Yeah!! I said not to go, so I followed you!!"

"Well, since you have, best stick with me..."

Heading out, they head over to Jake's friend's Joe's house. "Well, I wonder what this world is like..." Suddenly they see Joe in the front yard, practicing his baseball swing. "Hey Joe...

Joe's mom comes out. "Did you clean your room?"

"No." he lamented.

"You know the punishment." Suddenly she whipped out a Desert Eagle and blew out his brains right in front of them. With blood splatter and brain goo all over them, Jake shuddered and Sally screamed. "What's your problem? You've seen me blow Joe away several times before."

"Huh?" Jake utters, Joe's blood pooling at his feet.

"Alright... Are you guys not feeling well? I'll make you some soup if you aren't..."

"Would you believe we're not from this universe?" Jake blurted.

Joe's mom put her gun-toting hand to her chin and thought, then said, "Yes." It was a good thing she was like the Joe he knew, and believed that outlandish things like visitors from other worlds or even other universes was possible.

An hour later, around the table with bowls of soup, Jake exclaims, "So you're saying Joe will wake up perfectly fine tomorrow morning?"

"Yeah... It's always been like that." she says. "Basically, murder is a non-issue. People shoot, stab, immolate, and eviscerate each other on a daily, even minute-by-minute basis. Hell, killing the president is a minor citation at best."

"Wait? Everyone is immortal here?!" Jake blurts out.

"Immortal?! Who said that?! Of course you can die!! You wanna die?" Joe's mother retorts.

"Um... No."

"Basically, you know that show 'Avatar: The Last Airbender?' Well, there's a real life version of that, called the 'Vivit.' As long as the Vivit doesn't die, people can die all they want and wake up the next day unharmed, normally right after 6:00 AM..."

"Kinda like 'Kenny' from South Park..." Jake interrupted.

"Who?" Joe's mom wondered, never hearing of him. "Anyway, as long as you don't die of old age, you, and all your property, will wake up safe and sound... Although... ever feel what's it's like to get blown up in an atomic blast point blank? I have. IT HURTS, DAMMIT!!"

"Well, knowing that, I'm not as freaked out anymore over seeing my friend getting his brains splattered on the lawn as I was a moment ago. Still, the image kinda lingers..."

"Well, what now?" Sally says.

"Well..." Jake says...
1553322222222222221.title: Okay... I'm intrigued...

15533222222222222222222221.content:
After jumping through the mirror in his bedroom, Jake immediately found himself …

… sitting quietly at a table in a casino, his fingers slowly drumming across the green felt fabric of the table. All around him sat adults, dressed in tuxedos or elegantly sparkling evening gowns. In fact …

… yep! As Jake stole a glance downward at himself, he discovered he too was attired in a sleek, black tuxedo suit. Very interesting indeed.

“Your win, Mr. Young,” said a casino employee at the table. With a long pole, he pushed a pile of plastic tokens towards a bewildered Jake.

“Uh, thank you,” Jake said, clumsily collecting his winnings and rising from the table. He had no idea what game he had just been playing, and was consequently eager to avoid playing another round and losing what he had just so quickly gained.

“You win quite easily, Mr. Young,” said a dark, hostile voice on Jake's right.

He turned and saw a scowling, white haired man with an eye-patch and a fierce scar running the length of his left cheek.

“I wonder if you lose as gracefully as you win, Mr. Young,” the man growled.

“I … uh … I don't know,” stammered Jake, confused for a moment. “I've never lost.”

The comment just fell naturally from his lips without Jake really knowing where it had come from. Yet it pleased him to know he had irritated and annoyed this strange man.

“Mr. Young, we have a saying in my country,” the man with the eye-patch said. “One time is happenstance. Two times might be coincidence. But three times is an act of war. You have bested me twice, Mr. Young. I pray for your sake that you don't not cross my path again.”

The gain to the winner is always less than the loss to the loser, thought Jake as he nervously walked away from the strange character. He wasn't sure what type of odd new world he'd stumbled into, but it seemed quite evident Jake had already earned himself a mortal enemy.

“Don't mind him,” whispered a hot, breathy voice in Jake's left ear.

He turned and found himself face to face with a stunningly, drop dead brunette woman in a shimmering, black evening gown and long, satin black opera gloves.

“He is a thug, Jake!” said the woman. “Even Dr. Colossus knows that. He only tolerates the fool for his brute muscle. You have nothing to fear from him.”

“You should know me better than that by now, countess,” Jake found himself saying with a confident, almost arrogant air of self-assurance. “When it comes to matters of duty and honor for my country, I don't know the meaning of the word fear.”

“Fear can be a useful tool,” replied the countess, running her hand along Jake's chest. “It teaches us to avoid danger. Duty and honor will not serve you well when you're dead. Your trouble, Jake is that you see the world in terms of principles rather than people. You ought to surround yourself with humans instead of principles. They are easier to fight for.”

“At the moment, I'm hardly interested in fighting anyone,” Jake said, suddenly pressing his lips against this strange woman's mouth. “I think I'd much rather make love than war.”

“There is a time for everything, my dear Jake,” answered the countess, playfully pulling away from Jake. “And your time is coming later tonight. Good night, Mr. Young.”

The woman sauntered away from Jake, hypnotizing him with the rhythmic swaying of her tight bottom.

“If you can direct your attention away from the woman for a moment,” came an irritated older voice from behind Jake. “Pay attention now, Agent Omega. I've gone to great lengths to rendezvous with you and deliver your gear to you.”

Jake whirled around and came face to face with an older man with gray hair. He looked uncomfortably out of place in his tuxedo and seemed ill at ease in this swanky, posh casino.

“Now look here,” the man said, without bothering with introductions. “I have the latest edition of your watch here. All the standard features are incorporated in it. You'll also find an enhanced explosive, a poison dart shooter, and a tracking device with a more extended range than you're accustomed to. Now, as for this seemingly ordinary ball point pen. When you pull this lever, you'll activate a stream of corrosive liquid capable of dissolving all but the most hardened metals. I've parked your vehicle out front. It's the new experimental model, so whatever you do Agent Omega, don't push the red button on the gear shift. It will activate an untested passenger-side ejector seat.”

Jake nodded silently, accepting equipment from this strange man – apparently an ally now, rather than the enemy or the prospective love interest he had previously encountered. Difficult as it was to believe, apparently in this new version of reality, sixteen-year old Jake was not just an adult … he was a secret agent on some sort of clandestine mission of daring espionage and adventure!
15533222222222222222222221.title: The name is Young ... Jake Young.

'Did something happen to my shoes?' he wondered, looking down to see that his shoes were indeed missing - along with every other piece of clothing he had been wearing.

"What the hell?!" he shouted, instinctively covering his groin, "If this is some kind of side effect, it would have been nice to get a warning!"

Grumbling and face flushed, Jake started walking toward his dresser, only to stop short as he realized his dresser wasn't where it was supposed to be. Looking around, he saw that it was missing completely, and there wasn't any sign of a closet either.

"What gives? Where are my clothes?" he asked.

Whereas in their home reality the Mediterranean cultures were casual with nudity, the Greeks laid the foundations that the Romans built on. At some point early in Greek culture, everyone stopped wearing clothes, and the neighboring cultures followed, Earth seemed to be warmer in the universe, he noted.

Over the centuries, clothing simply never reappeared in Europe and North Africa, and the nude Europeans still built their empires and kingdoms, all in the buff, until the Mongols attacked. The Asian countries attack the Western ones, attempting to finally civilize them, and the wars both ended in a stalemate, within each culture closing its doors and forming a Cold War that hadn't ended yet, in seventy years.

After that wrap up, Jake and Sally looked a tad each other in a bit of shock at the state of the world. The bell rang, signaling the end of class, and they walked out toward their next class. But even the bits of debris that seemed half-intact looked alien to him. The kitchen was littered with the wreckage of high-tech appliances that bore little resemblance to the more mundane machinery Jake's mother had used. What he suspected was the television set was a shattered screen almost twice as large as the TV he recalled his family owning. Outside amongst the overgrown thicket of weeds stood the smashed remains of what had once been a sleek, futuristic car – like something out of a science fiction move set in the not-too-distant future.

“Where is this place?” he asked.

Nothing answered but a cold, bone-chilling breeze answered.

Jake began to explore the neighborhood. All the houses and cars he found were in various states of destruction as well. Although Jake found no signs of human remains, neither did he discover any sign of animal life whatsoever. No dogs, no cats, no birds … and certainly no human beings.

Was he the only human being left on the planet?

Had some terrible war finally wiped out civilization?

And would he ever find this world's analog to his aunt's mirror?

Without it, he would be stuck here forever!

As Jake walked along, he began to hear a distant, high-pitched whine from over the horizon. As it steadily grew louder and Jake still failed to see any signs of activity, he began to grow nervous. Picking his way across the piles of rubble that was now his home town, Jake moved steadily towards the source of the noise, eager to confront whatever it was. Anything would be better than the eerie, unpeaceful, quietness that permeated the abandoned wreckage of human civilization.

Just as he was about to cross a particularly big pile of concrete and steel debris, Jake finally heard the delightfully comforting sound of a fellow human voice.

“Get down you stupid son of a bitch!” shouted a young woman.

Turning around, Jake saw a short, scrawny woman dressed in the tattered remains of camouflage print military-issued fatigues. She was shaved bald, but still had an attractive, feminine face full of youthful energy. And at the moment, she wore an expression of both terror and rage on that face.

With a running jump, she careened into Jake, body-slamming him to the ground with a surprisingly powerful tackle.

“Hey, what's the big idea?” he started to say.

The woman instantly had one hand clamped over Jake's mouth. With the other hand, she grabbed him by the arm and roughly pushed him down into a seemingly random hole in the rubble pile. It looked like just a gap amidst the broken chunks of concrete and bricks. Once Jake had been flung down there, he discovered it was the mostly intact basement of some municipal building: a library, school, or maybe even city hall. The only light source was the trickle of sunlight making its way past the ceiling of mostly collapsed rubble above, so Jake couldn't see too well.

In a heartbeat, the woman in the torn combat uniform was down the hole beside him.

“Keep your voice down, Fresh Meat,” she hissed at him. “Didn't you hear the Vulture out there?”

“What? That buzzing sound? That wasn't any bird I've ever heard of,” Jake whispered back.

“No, you jackass!” she whispered. “Not a bird. A Vulture.”

Jake shrugged and looked dumb.

“A robotic jet-pod with rocket launchers and infrared scanners,” the woman explained in hushed tones. “ZoneMind's Overseers have been flooding this sector with 'bot patrols lately. Don't tell me you haven't seen the Vultures circling in the skies? You just admitted you heard 'em!”

“I'm … uh … I'm not from around here,” Jake said with a sheepish grin.

“No kidding, Fresh Meat!” said the woman, rolling her eyes. “You almost got yourself blown to pieces just now. There's no way you could have survived the Overseer's patrols the past couple of days. Who are you and just where the hell did you come from?”

“Uh, my name is Jake Young,” stammered Jake. For some reason, he felt his life might still be in danger if he gave this strange lady the wrong answer. “I'm actually not from here … I mean, not even from this universe.”

She looked back at him skeptically.

“No, really!” Jake continued. “You said it yourself. How else would I still be alive in this nightmare world? Listen, my aunt sent me this magic mirror and I used it to transport myself from one universe to another, and now …”

“Shut up,” commanded the woman.

“But I'm telling the truth,” Jake protested.

“I don't care, Fresh Meat!” snapped the woman. “That's not my call to make. You're an anomaly. And I've got orders about what to do with anomalies. You're coming with me back to HQ, Fresh Meat. We'll let the colonel decide what to do with you.”

“But I was just …”

“No more talking,” the woman ordered. “Get to your feet. The Vulture has passed by now. Up through that hole. I'll tell you where to go. If you try to make a run for it or pull any funny stuff, I'll kill you where you stand. Now, move!”

Jake found himself scrabbling up out of the hole and being directed across the bleak, rubble-strewn landscape, presumably to meet this mysterious colonel who would determine his fate.
1553322222222222222222222222221.title: The war is over. The robots won.

15533222222222222222222222222221.content:
Jake tumbled through the mirror and hit the dirty, dusty ground.

“Wow, I guess Aunt Diane's mirror really works,” he said, picking himself up off the dirt.

His attire had completely changed. Gone were every last remnant of twenty-first century garb, now thoroughly replaced by a coarse pair of breeches, some soft leather boots that barely rose to his ankles, and a dirty dark green tunic. A wide-brimmed straw hat sat atop his head.

As Jake looked around, he initially saw nothing but a typical rural scene. Jake stood on a lonesome, dusty dirt road. On either side of him sweeping fields of crops surrounded the road.

Then Jake turned around and gasped.

Behind him the whole time had been an enormous, stone castle – not the old abandoned ruins open to tour groups, but a solid, concrete version of something out of a Disney fairytale. Taut yellow and red flags and banners flew atop the tall towers high above him. Smoke came out from chimney holes scattered about the stone structure. As Jake listened, standing there in silent awe, he could hear the distant sounds of people busying themselves about the day-to-day process of life and work within the castle walls.

“Wow, Aunt Diane's mirror really works,” Jake say, craning his neck up and staring in wonder at the beautiful medieval monument before him.

“Huzzah there!” came a loud, authoritative voice from behind.

Jake spun around and came face to face with a mounted knight on powerful, muscular looking white horse. The warrior himself wore gleaming, hard steel armor polished to a brilliant, mirror-like shine. He carried a shield boasting a stylized blue lion against a field of light gray.

“I say, peasant!” said the knight in a strong, commanding voice. “Is this the castle of Glendower, Lord of the Western Marches? Answer me quickly boy. I haven't all day!”

“Uh … I don't know, sir,” Jake said, careful to emphasis the last word. He wondered if he should bow down before this mounted warrior.

“You don't know?” laughed the knight. “Explain yourself, knave!”

“I am a stranger in this place, sir,” Jake said, careful to avoid looking up at the knight. He sensed it would somehow be impertinent for a supposed peasant such as himself to look a knight in the eye. “I just now arrived at this castle myself, sir. I would greatly appreciate any guidance you yourself could give me … uh … sir.”

“A wandering peasant?” boomed the knight. He was silent for a moment, then started laughing merrily. “How very marvelous! Truly, now I have seen everything. And believe you me, good peasant, Sir Rowan of Northchapel has seen most of what is to be seen in these lands.”

“Uh, very good then sir,” Jake said.

“What name do you call yourself by, good peasant?” asked Sir Rowan.

“I am called Jake Young, if you please, sir,” answered Jake respectfully.

“Very good then, Jake the Younger,” replied Sir Rowan. “I take you as my squire. Together, we shall enter this castle – which I believe to be that of Glendower of the Western Marches. Unless it proves that I've been unable to read a map. Come Jake! We have quests to undertake, maidens to rescue, dragons to slay, and nothing but fortune and glory spread out on the path before us.”

Sir Rowan spurred his horse to life and the steed began to trot towards the castle.

Jake scrambled to keep up, unsure what else to do. He was a stranger in this strange land, and although he knew nothing about this Sir Rowan character, he figured it was better to have the knight as a friend rather than an enemy.

155332222222222222222222222222221.content:
I soon stepped through the mirror, the feeling like I was squeezed through a tube of toothpaste.

When I walked through I was standing on a train platform in what looked like Philadelphia. I had a laptop in one hand and a suitcase in another as the train pulled up. Before I could get on the train the conductor said "Identi-card." "What?" I asked "Identi-card." repeated the conductor. I rifled through my pockets to find a card that red.

Jacob Young
Age:16
Residence: New Sidon Province, Appalachian Commonwealth

The conductor took the card and scanned it in a machine in front of him. "Thank you citizen, I hope you have enjoyed your stay in the New Tarsus Province." "New Tarsus Province?" I thought out loud. "Yeah, its the province you were in and about to leave. I soon jumped on the train as it pulled out of the station and looked around. There were many people speaking in a variety of languages. "What the hell is going on?" I thought to myself.

info.brief_description: A  teen is given a mirror that allows him to travel to an alternate reality.
info.description:
Mirror of Reality



This Story is about a sixteen year old boy named Jake Young. Jake's life hasn't exactly been pleasant for him and he's always had a desire to go to another reality in hopes that he would find a perfect life there. One day he receives a gift from his great aunt Diane. This gift is a mirror that will allow him to travel to another reality, now with this gift will Jake be able to find his picture perfect reality? Or Will things only get worst? That is up to you to decide!

Family Members:
Note: I decided to add a list of known Family members here just for reference.


Sally Young
Age: 15
Height: 5 feet 2 inches
Weight: 145 lbs.
(These Things can and will possibly be changed in different realities.)

Aunt Diane
Age: 38
Height: 5 Feet
Weight: Unknown

Rules

1. While the Mirror Will transport Jake to another reality. Jake must find the mirror in each reality to go to another reality.
2. Jake must be follow the rules of that reality that he enters. (i.e. If he enters a reality where only women exists he will become one.)
3. If transformed in another reality, he may stay transformed until he reaches a reality that undoes that transformation or makes it worse.
4. If the Mirror breaks in the reality it is in Jake will be stuck in that Reality! Unless he finds another way.
5. Keep it PG-13 Please!
6. Enjoy and have fun!
